Reviews.Title: “Touted at 4 stars; It's not!”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy A
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is OK, but certainly not on par with other legitimate 4-star hotels we've stayed in. The floor we stayed on (8) was humid and smelled musty. Our room was very loud with wind noise and jet engine noise combined. As another poster stated, food prices are very high, on par with a high-quality steakhouse without the quality. It was good, but not good enough to justify the price. I liked the fact that they had shuttle service to nearby Grapevine for a $5 day pass, which gave us a chance to wander around downtown and enjoy the wineries, food and eclectic shops. My biggest complaint is that I called ahead and requested that all down items be removed from our room due to my wife's allergies. When she checked in, the front desk confirmed that there was not to be down in the room. When she got the room, there were down pillows on the bed. She requested that they be replaced, then we left for dinner. When we returned at about 10:30 p.m., the pillows on one of the two queen beds had been replaced but not the others. We asked for that to be fixed and waited nearly 40 minutes -- the last 15 in the hallway outside our room because the feathers make it impossible for her to breathe normally -- for the task to be completed. Then, even though I let the housekeeper into the room and we were right there when she finished, she looked at us, then closed and locked the door behind her. Luckily we had a key. We don't expect the down to be taken care of -- we call every time and every time we have to ask again once we get to our room. HOWEVER, for someone to literally only fix the problem halfway defies logic.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, and convenient if you're flying in”
Reviews.Author: hammkse
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious, clean, and comfortable. The hotel is connected to the airport, so we didn't need a cab. Meals are a little pricy in the restaurant and cafe, but if you're renting a car for sightseeing, it's not far from the interstate and lots of other food options. Great hotel for a meeting, as there's a small convention center on site.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: The5Ps
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located towards the north end of the DFW airport. Remember to ask the front desk or bell man to validate your airport toll ticket daily so you don't have to pay anything when you exit the airport toll gate. They will validate it for 16 hours. The room was very nice and modern in decor. Very clean. Not noisy. I didn't go into the restaurant, but it was hoppin' on Friday and Saturday nights and Sunday morning.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff and comfy rooms, but overpriced food and drink.”
Reviews.Author: Deidre R
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here a few times - rooms are comfortable, staff are very helpful and friendly. A good location if you have an early flight out. The negative is very over- priced food and drinks. For example a non- descript beer, two glasses of wine and a appeltizer my husband and i shared came to over $90 dollars! As we had returned our rental car we ate in their lobby restaurant, this was over $150, again for nothing special and included only one glass of wine, no appetizers. Their breakfast buffet, while fresh and lovely, was nothing special and was $35 a person.

Reviews.Title: “Good Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Parity
Reviews.Content: Hotel is designed for layovers, with shuttle buses that leave every 20 min on the hour and departure schedule screens in the lobby. The hotel is very close to the airport, approx 5 min shuttle. The rooms are modern and staff is efficient. The bed has a duvet but is a little on the hard side and could be a bit more comfortable for my taste. For dinner I had room service and the sea bass was very good. I have stayed more than once and recommend staying on the side away from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Susan0212
Reviews.Content: We got stranded at DFW due to the tornadoes. We spent two nights at the Hyatt Regency due to flight cancellations. Very clean and bedding was great! My only complaint would be the noise from the airport. Mister G's is a great steak house located in the hotel. Alittle pricey but the food was wonderful! Nice bar and lounge also. Would definitely stay here again if needed to.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and location for multi-day business meeting.”
Reviews.Author: Tampawolverine
Reviews.Content: Was here for a multi-day business meeting and everything was great except the weather as tornaodos made for interruptions and evacuations which were professionally handled with clear instructions about where to go during tornado emergency. The beds are extermley comfortable and the shuttle was always running which helped me re-book a cancelled flight in person at the airport rather than wait on the phone.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel and a GREAT airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: SuTengKai
Reviews.Content: I just had two days in the Hyatt Regency at DFW airport and was positively amazed at the experience. Everything was excellent. The staff were friendly and help, the hotel has been nicely renovated, my company had a large function and all support and arrangements were excellent, breakfast buffet was very good, the room was large with a wonderful king size bed and the cost was moderate. This was a great hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Bliss after a long flight”
Reviews.Author: Rhonda B
Reviews.Content: Service excellent, food in grill excellent, bed excellent. Had to pay for WiFi and breakfast, but I chose the package of the two for a reduced rate. I'd come in on the long flight from Sydney, Australia, so having a hotel so close to the airport was a big factor. However, if I came this way again, I'd probably pay a little more for the Grand Hyatt as there's no shuttle to catch, the rooms and amenities are even nicer, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch rooms and service”
Reviews.Author: CO0KIE_M0NSTER
Reviews.Content: Modern, quiet rooms and the hotel has free Wi-Fi. Restaurant/bar very good. We arrived late and had tapas at the bar...very nice.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best airport stays anywhere”
Reviews.Author: PhilattheBeach
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent another night in the Hyatt Regency DFW, and we both remarked that this excellent hotel has just gotten better. The front desk staff is always efficient, professional, and friendly. The rooms have always been immaculate and well equipped. The airport shuttle service is terrific. Because this hotel is right in the middle of the huge DFW airport property, you time between your room and your airline is amazingly short. This is a great place to get some much needed rest when travelling.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Hotel - Close to Airport. Great amenities”
Reviews.Author: SarasotaTrav
Reviews.Content: I have been visiting Hyatt Regency DFW for 15 years. i usually stay at the Grand Hyatt but it was booked. So i returned to the other Hyatt - Hyatt Regency DFW. I must say the renovations look great, excellent offerings in restaurants and bars. Rooms are all updated and clean. Definitely a great choice of the Grand Hyatt is booked or if you want something a bit less expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for business meeting”
Reviews.Author: bryhof
Reviews.Content: I was only in Dallas for less then 40 hours, but thought the Hyatt DFW was great. The meeting rooms were conveniently located and well appointed. All of the meals were well prepared and very tasty. The banquet meal was especially good and I appreciated being served by well dressed, polite and professional staff . These genterlmen were very attentive and went out of their way to provide a great dining experience. The hotel lobby and guest rooms were contemporary but comfortable and very well appointed. If I had to pick one item that the Hyatt excelled at, it would probably be the prompt , friendly and professional service that they provided from check in, to wait staff and bar service. I hate it when sloppy service ruins the experience, but I rreally appreciate it when the service puts the hotel or resturant over the top. Well done Hyatt DFW staff and management

Reviews.Title: “Sub-par for Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: gbn
Reviews.Content: Hyatts are usually good bets for a four-star experience, but Hyatt Regency DFW under-performs relative to its peers. The other DFW Hyatt was priced much more highly, though, so this might be a case of getting what you pay for. Check-in was very rapid and efficient, and the entryway area was spacious and clean. Room soundproofing is not impressive, and when planes were taking off or landing the room seemed louder to me than inside the airline terminal. Rooms were good-sized, with a nice bathroom. Towels were lesser quality than expected (I had better towels at La Quinta, the night before). Only one cup each caffeinated & decaffeinated coffee for the in-room coffee unit. The Hyatt stay-fit exercise room is usually a great feature, but the DFW Hyatt Regency's exercise room had older machines, was not nearly as large as at other locations, and didn't have the amenities and ambiance of its peers. 24-hour lobby coffee shop. Walking to the terminal was easy, though signage was poor.

Reviews.Title: “Book GRAND Hyatt not this Regency!!”
Reviews.Author: Dragon l
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a pain in the rear to get from dropping off the car, hauling bags up and down stairs in a parking garage, just to find the walkway over to this run-down hotel. It is badly in need of a face-lift. Everything is just worn and a bit grungy. Not the worst hotel ... but why not just stay at the GRAND Hyatt in the airport instead? At the Regency, to catch a flight in the morning, you have to take a shuttle, which only runs every 20 minutes becuase it's the most retardedly-designed airport on the planet and it takes forever to get to a terminal. This is NOT a hotel where you just walk straight into the airport and catch a plane. They have Mr. G's restaurant, which was fine but didn't knock my socks off. And it should have given their sky-high prices. The Grand Hyatt had better food too and was far less of a pain.

Reviews.Title: “Airport convinent but poor service”
Reviews.Author: Donnamackc
Reviews.Content: Wifi in the room was awful, it never stayed connected for more than 10 minutes. I called because my tv was not working and maintenance never came up to see about it. The food in the restaurant was not a good value, hummus wrap had very little hummus. Breakfast was good and meeting facilities are great for large groups.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Your Average Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheFielding
Reviews.Content: This Hyatt is definitely better than your average higher end airport hotel. The high points: free parking, renovated rooms, airport views, decent restaurant, on-airport, lots of elevators Low points: no status recognition beyond free internet, front desk staff quality lower than other Hyatts I've recently stayed at, nowhere near anything due to on-airport location, shower height extremely low (I'm 6'3 and I had to watch my head while in the shower to avoid hitting the ceiling). This hotel is not a bad hotel and it kills most other brands' airport hotels out of the park. However it is quite clear they are attempting to differentiate between this hotel and the nearby Grand Hyatt. I was at this hotel for about 15 hours total, of which 8 of them were sleep. The rest were spent in the restaurant and in my room. The restaurant staff were the highlight of the experience. Everyone was insanely friendly and I had long conversations with two of them about life, family, and work, it was really great since I was travelling alone for work. The food however wasn't up to the same quality level, it was acceptable though. The front desk staff were friendly enough but when I checked in they did not recognize the HGP Platinum/Diamond line nor did they recognize my status at all beyond informing me that my rate included breakfast (AAA rate). I know that welcome gifts are not part of the platinum guaranty but this is the first Hyatt I have been at where I did not receive a welcome gift, let alone any recognition at all. I also did not receive a preferred room that I requested (runway view, nor a higher floor). As I was travelling on a Saturday I find it hard to imagine that all the higher floor and/or runway view rooms were taken. Aside from that this hotel was quite nice. The rooms are small but can allow for a lot of space. There is a movable desk and the bed is very comfortable. The TV was of decent quality though the reception on some of the channels was subpar, which is something I have a hard time fathoming in this day and age. There was a desk chair and separate lounging chair in the room as well. The bathroom was well stocked with both mouthwash and toothpaste and apart from the extremely tight fit in the shower the bathroom renovations were a definite plus. If I were to go to DFW again I'd likely stay at the Grand Hyatt as I think it would be a better experience but I wouldn't be disappointed or against staying at this Hyatt Regency again. If you're trying to save some cash or just need a bed to crash in for a night then the Regency is the place for you. Though it seems as though the Grand Hyatt DFW (I've never been) is a better place for longer stays, though I can't imagine why you'd have a long stay at DFW unless you're an aviation consultant. As always I hope this review is helpful and if you have any questions regarding my review just send me a message.

Reviews.Title: “Good Renovated Airport Hotel But Not Cheap”
Reviews.Author: Sammyfloyd
Reviews.Content: My last review of this hotel was in 2007. The hotel is now completely renovated. Location: Right in the middle of DFW airport but it's not connected to any terminals directly. It's a short walk though to one of the terminals from the parking garage where you can then access Skytrain for the rest of the airport. Free parking included. You can also get the airport tolls validated at the bell desk or the front desk. Service: Good and friendly faces throughout. Rooms: All renovated overall so the quality is good with new furnishings. Room size is good and the bed is comfortable. There is an iPhone dock that serves as an alarm clock. The bathroom does not have a tub but just a large shower. Large flat screen TV is the standard these days. Runway noise was not noticeable. Breakfast: Booked on a corporate rate that included buffet breakfast (normal rate is around $17). Quality is decent. The omelette station does a good job, and the fruit selection was excellent. Cereal selection could have been improved though. Hyatt Place is better in that area. Coffee tasted diluted and poor. Other facilities: Didn't try the pool or the fitness center. There is ample convention space at the basement and a nice bar area. Internet costs money unless your plan includes it, or unless you are an elite Hyatt member. Overall: The hotel is above average but it usually costs over $200 on weekdays so it doesn't come cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Quick stay, great staff”
Reviews.Author: philipstrnad
Reviews.Content: Quick pick up from the airport (less than 5 minutes after call) wonderful clean, comfy room. You can certainly see the effects of a multi million dollar renovation. Great staff at this hotel. Great rooms, great service.

Reviews.Title: “Happily surprised...”
Reviews.Author: Seattleite64
Reviews.Content: How good can an "airport hotel" really be? Especially one that is acutally IN the airport? The answer in this case is "really good!" For logistics reasons, our team needed to meet in a central location, easy for all of us to get to without a lot of hassle, for a one-day meeting. All of us bemoaned having to go to an airport hotel, just knowing how beaten up many can be. Hyatt Regency DFW was a nice and inexpensive surprise. While it is now the "old maid" of the DFW Hyatt properties (the newer is the Grand Hyatt), the management and ownership has done a good job at keeping up appearances. Rooms were clean and well-appointed. Restaurants and bars all far above-average. The catering (remember, we had a team meeting) was unexpectedly well-done and the food well-prepared and tasty! Given it's location, it is not a "destination" hotel. But, if you need to layover or you have a group meeting like us, there is no need to go outside DFW itself if you want to avoid hassle, transporation costs, etc. Nice job, Hyatt Regency DFW!

Reviews.Title: “Good airport location for meetings”
Reviews.Author: johnvermont
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in good shape, nice conference facilities and services. Rooms are beginning to look worn but still good condition. Lounge is good with reasonable menu and prices but restaurant is over priced. Hotel provides shuttle to airport and some local restaurant for convenience.

Reviews.Title: “A ROOM WITH A BALCONY”
Reviews.Author: treking
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel not only for the airport location, but to be able to open a door for air. I often wonder how well hotel air filters are being maintained and what size particles the filters are removing. Do not expect a lovely wide balcony with a great view, even if the room is facing a runway. This is not a resort, but having access to air is a rare luxury! Terminal C has a walkway to the Hyatt near door 21. Â Â  Â  At terminal C, as with all terminals, there is a light rail Â (within secure areas) and bus shuttles for Â transferring to other terminals. I understand that the Hyatt does provide shuttles every 20 minutes to other terminals. MY room was comfortable and 'hotel clean'. Decor was not 'WOW', but 'business' acceptable. The bed was comfortable and there was a 'white noise' of surrounding traffic The staff was accommodating. Â WiFI, somewhat unreliable, normally provided for a fee, was offered for free.Â  The only issue that I had with the hotel was the food. Â  Probably because it was Christmas eve, the only restaurant that was open was the lobby bar. The crab cake and salad that I ordered were rather unappetizing and in my opinion very expensive. Â Perhaps if they were more flavorful, I would have considered the prices to be more reasonable. Â Breakfast was better, and the service was Â excellent. In summary, this is not a luxury hotel, but more than acceptable with some excellent attributes. The rate charged for the room was very reasonable Â for a good night's sleep and I would not hesitate to stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Always a good experience”
Reviews.Author: T_Richelle
Reviews.Content: I travel back and forth between Dallas and Canada on a regular basis and have stayed at this hotel countless times since 2007. I have found that the Hyatt Regency is a great value, and I actually prefer it to the Grand, even though that hotel is linked to the international terminal. The staff at this hotel have always been professional and friendly- just what I like. (great in room dining staff) The executive suites are wonderful if you are traveling with family.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel at the airport”
Reviews.Author: OragneCountyThor
Reviews.Content: You can walk through the parking lot to this hotel from the terminal. This is the hotel used by airline personnel during layover, and used by businesses to hold meetings as most airlines fly to DFW. Great bar. The rooms are comfortable and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “nice experience”
Reviews.Author: simkomd
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in january for the Cotton Bowl. Getting to the property was challenging at first because of the airport location and because of construction, but after the second go around, it was not a problem. Parking was free which was nice. The staff was very helpful and the rooms were nice. Some noise because of the airport location, but nothing that kept us from getting rest. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Average Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Magazinedude
Reviews.Content: Great Beds and Great Location... A little bit of a pain getting in and out thru the airport. The parking is free !! If you are just in the Dallas area for a day or so this hotel has everything. They charge for internet. The front desk checked me in very quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with specious rooms”
Reviews.Author: Sandeep420
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed by the superb room - very specious, nicely decorated and well furnished. I used the kiosk for automated check-in and check-out and it was very quick. The shuttle took longer than expected to arrive to pick us up at the airport terminal. The shuttle from the hotel to the airport was also full and could not accommodate all the people that were waiting. The staff was friendly and welcoming. Had breakfast in the restaurant - it was quite average and the service was slow but I didn't have high expectations to begin with.

Reviews.Title: “Typical business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sandikot
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property twice in recent months and have found the staff to be welcoming and the rooms are definitely on the large side. The shuttle bus always arrives promptly at the international terminal when called and takes only a few minutes to the hotel. The main plus is the size of the rooms, I've always had a spacious room with a decent bathroom, just what you need after a long flight.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Gregsuzanne
Reviews.Content: If you are just flying in and out and need a bed to stay or wanting to see Dallas this is a great place to stay, the staff are friendly and helpful and the food it fantastic well worth a visit. The total package starts when you are picked up by the free shuttle bus to take you to the hotel ( our driver was Bill) so helpful talking about the hotel and happy to help with any questions that we asked also remember our names when we came down stair later in the day a great asset to the hotel. As we were staying in a quiet time of the year we also were luck enough to be able to have ala carte breakfast at no added cost very nice. We had dinner at Aces lobby bar both night we stayed it was great we were served by Ron another good employee for the hotel. The food was fantastic. The hotel also has a Starbucks coffee available. So all round we had a great stay, why do you give it a go next time you visit you will no be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for the business traveler”
Reviews.Author: Basiluzzo
Reviews.Content: I knew that the Grand Hyatt at DFW was the nicer of the two airport Hyatts, so I was worried, but this place is fine. The conference facilities are a good, although I don't think the hotel is used to handling conferences as big as the one I attended - internet would bog down at peak hours, and the group meals were in a strange converted storage room in the bowels of the hotel. My room has spacious and comfortable, although dark - the half-window looked out on a wall of the hotel and the inner courtyard of a parking garage. The hotel bar is comfortable with a good menu, but gets noisy and is too small. You can call for a shuttle from the DFW terminals, but it's just as easy to walk from terminal C, if you're OK with finding your way across a parking garage and going up and down a few half staircases. So - ugly setting, but if you're at a conference, that doesn't matter. I would discourage vacationers from staying here, there's no public transportation to DFW and cab rides are far from anywhere. On the other hand, it would be convenient for overnight if you have an early departure or a late arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for night before flight”
Reviews.Author: djess55555
Reviews.Content: When I read Hyatt Regency, I tend to think of a fairly nice hotel. Not this time. I hooked into this hotel dirt cheap by bidding on Priceline. It's primary focus are business meetings, because of the airport location. The service in the bar was horrendous. My wife and I went in for drinks. There were waiters and waitresses everywhere, emerging from the kitchen with and without food or drinks, wandering around among the tables, ignoring us totally. I tried to get the attention of a number of them. No luck. We were dressed nicely. We have no obvious malformities or diseases. We were sitting quietly and respectfully. Finally, we just went up to the bar, ordered our drinks directly and carried them up to our room. The value of this hotel is that it is right on the airport property. You can drop your rental car off at the rental car center the night before your flight, take the rental car bus to the C terminal, tell the driver you want to get off at the Hyatt, and get dropped of within a very short walk through a parking lot to the hotel. No taxi. No tips. No hassle.

Reviews.Title: “So Convenient to Texas Antique Shopping”
Reviews.Author: GloriaMunday
Reviews.Content: My husband had a conference at the hotel, Tuesday- Sunday. Perfect for flying in for the conf. Each day I went antique shopping. This turned out to be the perfect hub for scouting out Texas Antiques. We also met up with several friends /relatives one evening for dinner at the nearby Gaylord Hotel~( Texas Rangers were on TV....and won). We live on the East coast and this location was just the best for us. I used their dry cleaning service-it was fine. I had a van that I self parked. ( I had driven to TX in Sept.,knowing that I was returning to Texas I left my van at airport parking...so I had a van waiting to use.)The hotel can endorsed parking tickets for registered guest. We ate breakfast at the hotel and it was ''delish''!. The room was nice and we had a view of the planes landing and take off. Morning papers were at a premium...get downstairs early to get one! We arrived before 10 am and the hotel was able to get us into a room with in an hour...we ate breakfast and read the newspaper while we waited.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: 2Babyboomes
Reviews.Content: We chose this airport hotel based on price. Having stayed at the Grand Hyatt on our arrival in the US 3 weeks earlier, we were a bit concerned that this might be a disappointing comparison. Not at all. It was an exceptional hotel. Overall, I preferred our experience at this hotel. All of the staff were extremely friendly and went out of their way to be helpful and our room was terrific - large, very comfortable and clean (not as modern and glamorous as the GH, but still a great room) and quiet despite overlooking one of the runways. We ate at Jacobe's Grille for both breakfast and dinner. Breakfast was delicious, but dinner was the real winner! By far the best meal and service during our time in the US. We also grabbed a couple of take away salads from the coffee bar and these too were really good. Our only difficulty was actually getting to the Regency from Terminal A. We figured there would be a shuttle service and that there would be clear signs on how to access it. However we couldn't find signs and being Australian, we had no cell phone connection to call the hotel. We were advised by an Information guy to take an airport bus to a certain point and walk the rest of the way. DON'T DO THIS!! If you haven't organised the shuttle, take a cab. However, the free shuttle is such an excellent service it's a pity not to take advantage of it. I suggest the hotel give clear instructions on how to access the shuttle on their website AND reservation confirmation to avoid the inconvenience we experienced. Despite our shaky start, I would certainly recommend this hotel if you're flying into any of the terminals other than Terminal D. It's hard not to recommend the Grand if you're flying into Terminal D purely for the convenience. But overall, I much preferred our experience at the Hyatt Regency.

Reviews.Title: “In the words of Madeline Kahn in Blazing Saddles, "How owdinawy!"”
Reviews.Author: Roskolnikov
Reviews.Content: I am accustomed to the Hyatt Regency brand applying to a moderately upscale hotel. This one, however, was a basic concrete block with the ambiance of a well-maintained Econo Lodge. Entirely surrounded by the Dallas-Fort Worth airport, it features breathtaking views of three parking structures. There is noplace to walk other than these structures. Clean and well-staffed, it is the perfect hotel to stay in before an early flight or after a late one. And it is ideal for anyone who is coming to Dallas and wants to avoid seeing Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “As good as many downtown hotels”
Reviews.Author: gt_a_lif
Reviews.Content: When I walked into the Lobby and saw that there was a convention here I shook my head. Who has a convention at an airport hotel? But after one night at the DFW Hyatt I am sold that this is as good as most downtown hotels from other brands. There are several restaurants, incredibly friendly and efficient front desk staff, a nice, large room with all of the amenities, good wi-fi service, a comfortable bed and a clean bathroom. But my only issue was the HVAC system, which, even after being â€œfixedâ€� by maintenance was still problematic. My room had 2 queen beds and still had ample room for walking around. The desk and its chair were comfortable and the TV swirled so I could work on my computer at the desk and still watch. There are three pillows on each bed. The shampoo, conditioner and soap are already in the shower so look there before calling down to housekeeping. My issue with the HVAC was it could not achieve the desired temperature with an early freeze in Dallas. I called maintenance and they set someone to fix it. She assured me it was fixed, left the thermostat set at 78 and told me to find the temperature I liked and then re-set the thermostat. The room never went above 71.4. Not cold but still in need of fixing. I went to the lobby bar for a quick dinner, a chicken quesadilla and a cheeseburger with fries. The quesadilla was really a soft taco they ran through a Panini press. The avocado was under-ripe and the chicken had that jelly-like texture and there was loads of melted cheese. I would not recommend. The burger was good but mine had a wide variation in the salt. One bite had none and then the next my head snapped back. The French fries were basic frozen in 25 pound bags and fried when ordered. The server was excellent and friendly. Hey itâ€™s a lobby bar at an airport hotel, better than I expected, but not great. There is also a coffee maker in the room. Unfortunately housekeeping only left de-caf. I went downstairs and the front clerk gave me a coupon for a large coffee at Starbucks. No THAT is customer focus. There are also two airline check-in boarding pass computers in the lobby, great idea, plus the shuttle to the airport runs every 20 minutes. For an airport hotel this is a great place to stay if you have an early flight and do not want to fight traffic from downtown. I recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property”
Reviews.Author: shamekila
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed staying at this property. The front desk workers were very nice. Typically, I book with Hotwire and sometimes that changes the reaction of the front desk workers. I really enjoyed this hotel. My husband and I stayed here to relax after we came back from Cancun and I must say I relaxed very well. You can not hear the airplanes. The shuttle service is very fast and runs like clock-work.

Reviews.Title: “very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Chew302
Reviews.Content: We were here for a conference and stayed for 2 nights. We had a great room with a airport view. The Grand might look nicer but nothing wrong with this hotel. Rooms are renovated and the Bar makes great pizzas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and very convenient!”
Reviews.Author: sccollins_11
Reviews.Content: I had originally booked a room for $90/nt which I thought was a great value. We called the hotel to inquire about parking since we would be gone for a full week. They told us about their Park and Stay rate. For $160, you get the room for the night and a week of parking in Terminal C. What a bargain! I don't think we could have parked in the Express lot for that rate. We weren't in our room long as we arrived late and departed early, but it was very nice. Shuttles to the terminals depart every 20 min. Upon our arrival back at the airport, a shuttle arrived in about 10 min to take us back to the hotel (our car) and we were greeted by a friendly driver and cold bottles of water.

Reviews.Title: “Respite in a Storm”
Reviews.Author: godsbooboo
Reviews.Content: Traveling from Reno, NV, to Houston, TX, via DFW Airport was quite the adventure: plane in Reno needed repair before take-off; arriving late at DFW, therefore missing our connecting flight; placed onto a flight (4 hours later at 10:45 p.m.) out of DFW to Houston which ended up being canceled due to "weather," even though we could hear and see other planes taking off; being told American Airlines would, however, provide cots and blankets for those stranded. After re-booking our flight to Houston for the next afternoon we took the airport Skylink to the Grand Hyatt. Their price for a double queen room was almost $200; we asked for any kind of discount, but there wasn't any. So, we took a shuttle to the Hyatt Regency DFW (on airport property but close to a different terminal). What a welcome we received there! Unbelievable. We were given a discount for being stranded on top of a AAA discount, a total of $50 less than the Grand Hyatt, and we were able to have a king room. Tom, the man checking us in, was a breath of fresh air after a very trying day. The hotel was clean, as was our room, and the room was very comfortable. Tom had asked if we wanted a late check-out (2 p.m.) the next day, since our new flight wasn't until 4:00, which we were very happy to take. We were able to have a good night's rest in very quiet, comfortable surroundings. I would recommend staying at this hotel for anyone who is stranded at DFW Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for DFW travelers”
Reviews.Author: Ali432
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I have stayed at this location on several locations. The hotel is conveniently situated on the DFW property near the C terminal with shuttle service to and from the terminal, along with a flight arrival and departure board located in the lobby area. The lobby is clean and spacious, the staff helpful and pleasant, the rooms are comfortable with a modern decor, although somewhat dark. The hotel stamps the DFW toll ticket and parking is free for guests.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Lucia B
Reviews.Content: I stayed the week of Nov.14th. Loved everyting about it. Clean, friendly. The Jacob's spring griles buffet was fantastic, I did not leave a crumb on my plate. The only thing that bothered me was a smell, very subtle smell of may be dampness? But then again I have super sensitivity to a lot of smells.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and nice room for the money”
Reviews.Author: copyrocket
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a lay over and was expecting a basic room for $90 per night. Very surprised and love the room. Nice decor, friendly staff and a comfy bed.

Reviews.Title: “Only for Business Travelers”
Reviews.Author: er22
Reviews.Content: The only reason to come here is if you are desperate to stay next to the airport. The rooms are adequate and they have decent meeting space for conferences. I will admit that the conference food (at least lunch) was better than average. The on-site restaurants are ridiculously expensive--literally $60 for a steak or chops. When we looked at the Mister G's steakhouse the maitre d' practically cornered us and was very pushy--insisting we would have a "memorable meal" and asking if we were on expense accounts which I thought was a bit crass. We opted for the less expensive option "Jacob's Spring Grille" which was still way over-priced and mediocre. They know you are trapped there and charge as much as they can for everything. I would only stay here if required for business travel of was stuck at DFW on an unexpected overnight delay.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: Miusa
Reviews.Content: From the moment I checked in (Tom did a great job helping me become familiar with the facilities and amenities) until I checked out the staff was thoughtful, informative and attentive. The service I received here from every employee I encountered was, without exception, outstanding. The room was well appointed and maintained. The room was also very clean. The wifi service worked well, television was modern and offered a lot of selections. I enjoyed the room service for breakfast twice and was pleased with the selection and of course the service. The only opportunity for improvement was the overall facility appears to be dated and in need of a slight refreshing but is very well maintained and clean. Just older. Overall great space to stay. The location was ideal as it seemed close to all my appointments and of course it was great when it came time for the early morning return flight. I highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jsvalen
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel regularly. It is very well appointed with lovely decor - very comfortable. You can't beat the location since it's right next to DFW. I got free wifi. I wish the business center offered free printing, but you have to pay to use the printer (unless for a boarding pass). The staff is always friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Before Flight”
Reviews.Author: Eliza52
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay prior to an early morning flight. We used priceline and got a discounted rate. Hotel is clean, quiet, and convenient--exactly what is needed prior to an early flight.

Reviews.Title: “Restful overnight layover”
Reviews.Author: clifster
Reviews.Content: While traveling with my wife and young daughter, we had an overnight layover (flight arriving about 11pm and departing 7am). We had to wait maybe 10 minutes for the hotel shuttle, but the driver very graciously offered us small bottles of ice water. Of course we then tipped him, but the gesture was much appreciated after a long day. Our checkin was quick and efficient, and the lobby and public space was contemporary and appealing. We went straight to our room, and were impressed by the room. The beds, bedding, and selection of pillows were upscale and very comfortable. The room seemed recently updated. The bathroom was nice, and included a full set of toiletries, including a travel-sized toothpaste -- an uncommon addition. We were not aware of any airport noise. We slept well, enjoyed the in-room coffee maker, grabbed a free newspaper, and boarded the efficient shuttle back to the airport. All in all, a perfect choice for a good night's sleep on an overnight layover. I would not choose to spend more at the *other* airport hotel for such a brief stay, since the shuttle is so quick and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed at better 2 stars”
Reviews.Author: springtx249
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? No tub in the bathroom. The bathroom door didn't latch and the sink didn't drain. Also our wake up call was 15 minutes late. This is pricelines 4 star in the area. Don't waste your money!

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the night”
Reviews.Author: FloridaTerry
Reviews.Content: We got stuck in Dallas on a Sat night. Our choices were sleep in the airport or go to the hotel. We went to the hotel and were glad that we did. We didnt have much with us and they sent up some tolities for us. We were able to get a good night sleep and were able to walk to the terminal for our 6:00am flight the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Airport Hotel at Terminal”
Reviews.Author: samjust08
Reviews.Content: Excellent airport hotel in terminal area (shuttle required). Couldn't be any more convenient without being in the actual terminal itself. Its a 1 minute ride from the hotel to the terminals. The best part is the price. It's half the price of most 'in terminal' hotels, and at least 80% as convenient. I've stayed there twice, and will be there again in March. I highly recommend this place for an overnighter or a couple of days. I've stayed there when attending the Cowboys Classic and earlier this year at the Cotton Bowl. Couldn't have been happier.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Business Motel”
Reviews.Author: nirvananinja
Reviews.Content: This is a solid business motel that has been upgraded and in many ways is better then the Grand Hyatt across the way. The bar and restaurant are better than the smaller and more stuffy offerings at the Grand Hyatt. Meeting room facilities serve the need. On the downside, it is definitely less convenient than the Grand and requires either a shuttle ride (one time took a staggering and incomprehensible 45 mins to reach my gate, despite being located in the airport) or a not-too-long walk that goes up and down a series of stairs through the parking lot and in the brutal Dallas heat. Only other downside is that like it's Grander cousin, this hotel oddly has no hot tub. Maybe it's that heat thing. Killer views of the airport can be for great views of planes landing and taking off and there is a sliding door with a small balcony available in all of the rooms I believe.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay for a great price”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler5261
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel recently to attend a college football game. Granted it wasn't that close to many of the main Dallas attractions, it was an upscale hotel and we got a room at a very affordable rate. We enjoyed our stay very much. The hotel looks like it had recently undergone some rennovations, so everything looked very new. The front desk was very kind and accomodating. My favorite part of the hotel was the excellent rooms and very comfortable beds. We had a room on the 11th floor with excellent views of the airport and departing planes. The room was also very nice in the sense that you hardly ever heard the planes taking off, so we got a good night's sleep. I was at first wary of staying at the airport because potential access issues outside of the aiport property. But this really was no problem. By staying at the hotel we got to park for free. Just be aware though that you MUST validate your airport parking ticket with the front desk at the hotel before you leave otherwise you're stuck leaving the airport paying unnecessarily for parking. I would very much recommend this hotel to anyone staying overnight at the airport and would even recommend it to someone looking to stay in the Dallas area longer than just overnight as this is a very nice hotel at a very affordable cost. We'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you're transiting through DFW”
Reviews.Author: ZazfromSydney
Reviews.Content: From booking online months in advance to checking out, our experience was fantastic. Booking was easy, rate was fantastic and included breakfast. The room and facilities were excellent and every single customer service staff member encountered went above and beyond to make our stay that little bit extra special. The nachos was the biggest serving of anything I've ever ordered!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a stopover in between flights”
Reviews.Author: MazV
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by friendly smiles and helpful staff. The whole experience of this hotel was great. Highly recommended for anyone wanting a rest stop in between connecting flights!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel...”
Reviews.Author: GB4469
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the DFW Hyatt Regency, which is located on the DFW airport property, the night before a 6:30a flight. This is an older property that has been completely renovated top to bottom (including bathrooms) and is quite lovely. The room was very clean with flat screen TV. The bath had a walk-in shower type arrangement that you find in the newer hotels. The vanity area was separate with a granite countertop, which was nice. For the ladies, there was a magnifying makeup mirror - always appreciated. No shower caps though. They do provide toothpaste, soap, shampoo, conditioner and lotion (I believe it was). There was a large full length mirror in the room and two smaller long mirrors on the closet doors in the vanity area. In our room, there were two electrical outlets on one side of the bed, but none on the other. However there were additional outlets in the desk area, which proved ample. The room was amazingly quiet for being at an airport. We did not hear any plane noise during the night. There was a complimentary shuttle to all of the airport terminals that ran 24 hours a day on the 20's (top of the hour, 20 minutes after and 40 minutes after). Also, free airport parking for nights stayed at the hotel. Just remember to get your parking validated. We had dinner at Jacob's Spring Grille and it was quite good with lovely presentation. May I suggest the crabcakes...excellent! My only two complaints are these: 1. There were two bottles of water in the room (about 16 oz size), for which a charge of $4 per bottle was levied if consumed. 2. There was a $15 per device/per day access fee for computers, i-pads, etc. This is not the place to stay if you are in the DFW area as a tourist, but would highly recommend if you have an overnight layover, an early morning flight, or circumstances that require you to be at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, but mixed reviews”
Reviews.Author: Tam0922
Reviews.Content: Great airport location if you are flying from DFW. Shuttle runs every 15-20 minutes. The is a much older looking hotel. Pros: location, friendly staff, very comfy beds, nice amenities, good price. speedy check in and check out. nice decor. nice size room. You can print your boarding passes free at check in/out. Cons: This is a much older hotel....no shower door, so water runs everywhere. We used all our towels cleaning up the water. tiny tiny bathroom, parking garage was scary and dirty. not enough lighting so do no not walk alone. my room was dusty and need a really good cleaning.. the curtains were dirty as was the carpet and chair. Hotel needs a changing room near pool area. very slow internet connection (for a fee) The Grand Hyatt is MUCH nicer and a little more expensive, but its worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Hustle”
Reviews.Author: iluvdatiger
Reviews.Content: First lets go over the positives. Excellent location if you want a hotel near the airport. Their airport shuttle runs every 15 minutes. Sound proof windows, so we never heard the planes. Comfy bed. Reasonably priced. Has a bar and restaurant and a pool. Now the not so good part. Let's talk about the shower or lack thereof first. Whoever thought it was a good idea to have a open shower with no door should be fired. Half of the water from our showers ended up on the bathroom floor. We used all our towels cleaning up the pool of water every day. But the most insane thing about this hotel is the way their employees try to hustle their guests. Instead of calling you a cab they will pressure you into taking a car service which just so happens to have three lincolns sitting out front. DO NOT BELIEVE A WORD THE CONCiERGE/DOORMAN TELLS YOU about the car service being the cheaper option. Tell them to shutup and call you a cab. They are clearly in cahoots with thiscar service company and flat out lied to us that the car service was cheaper than the cab. SHAME ON MGMT for allowing this type of behavior. THEN, while we sat in the bar having a drink, we were approached by an older man who said he worked in the hotel restaurant. He tried to pressure us into cancelling our dinner reservations at Pappas Bros claiming it was really far away. THIS IS NOT TRUE. Pappas Bros is 10 miles from the hotel. We eventually had to tell him we were meeting friends there just so he would leave us alone! Extremly unprofessional and annoying. I was disappointed at the dishonesty by the employees. Instead of being helpful and honest with out of towners they preferred the hustle approach. Won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Plush property was excellent accomodations”
Reviews.Author: jwrob1
Reviews.Content: This is a nice property with an excellent staff. Accomadations were first class. Only wish I could have stayed longer. Early morning flight. Hotel shulttle was on time and helpful in getting to the gate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, friendly staff but wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: farmerboyNorthants
Reviews.Content: There are two Hyatt hotels next to DFW airport, I must admit that I made a mistake booking the Regency (much older looking building) and should have booked the new one â€˜The Grand Hyattâ€™. Although there was nothing majorly wrong with my stay I donâ€™t think I would stay at that hotel again especially if I intended in spending a little extra time using the facilities etc. I found there were a few niggles with the hotel overall such as: - There isnâ€™t a changing room next to the pool so if you wanted to use the pool you have to get changed in the hotel lobby restroom then walk through with your speedoâ€™s on past the bar and restaurant! - Once you have checked out there isnâ€™t anything else to do apart from leave the hotel as you canâ€™t go and have a work out for example in the gym and get all sweaty as there isnâ€™t a changing room there either and nowhere to have a shower! - WiFi â€“ Costâ€™s nearly $15 for 24 hours and is so slow it hardly downloads webpages. Call to complain then had to call a call centre myself to resolve the issue but was still running at 34kpbs.. - Breakfast selection wasnâ€™t brilliant, I managed to have a selection of fruit but that was all. There wasnâ€™t soya milk available. Donâ€™t get me wrong the hotel is nicely appointed throughout and the rooms are spacious with comfortable beds, feather pillows and more importantly quiet AC. However my room was a little dirty in places such as the desk chair was covered in stains, god only knows what though! Check in was really quick as I did this online beforehand so just used my phone on the scanner on arrival. Nice touch!

Reviews.Title: “Great for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: LaurenR29
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency DFW was a great hotel - clean, good service, good food options. The room was great, spacious, and had everything I needed. The desk on rollers made it easy to turn into a dining table when a friend brought me takeout for dinner. The meeting rooms were also very nice. It's hard to get anywhere since it's by the airport, but considering the location it was quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “The best place we stayed for our whole trip to the USA”
Reviews.Author: dolang
Reviews.Content: We had to evacuate NYC prior to Hurricane Irene hitting and we were sent to Dallas Texas for our connecting flight to Brisbane. However due to traffic (2 hours in a cab to Newark) we missed our flight from NY to Dallas and had to stay overnight before flying out the next day. After that nightmare we arrived at Dallas Airport with no where to stay. Luckily there were free computers in the arrivals hall and we booked online to stay at the Hyatt Regency. What fabulous service, the best room we stayed in for our whole trip and very quiet. What started out as disaster turned out to be a blessing to have a night and day in Dallas. Your shuttle drivers are fantastic by the way. We took the shuttle bus to Grapevine and spent the day being tourists. Great coffee and nice drinks in the bar before flying home. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay AT the airport!”
Reviews.Author: WeLuvBah
Reviews.Content: I booked the Hyatt Regency DFW through the Hyatt website for a conference at the beginning of August 2011. After traveling for nearly 24 hours and arriving at DFW, we were very happy with the rapid response from the driver who picked us up and got us to the hotel quickly. The check in process was quick and smooth and we received exactly the room that we booked. I will say that I was very surprised with the location as most airport hotels are near the airport; from my room I had a great view of terminal C at DFW - this hotel is AT the airport! With that in mind, the noise level was not bad; although you can hear the aircraft taking off and landing, it was not so loud as to keep us awake. One significant limitation to this airport is the proximity to anything. If you do not have a car, there is little choice in dining options other than the outlets within the hotel which, although good, were quite expensive. There is a shuttle to Grapevine for a fee but we did not use it. I was informed by a staff member that if you needed to use a cab to get in to town, it would cost upwards of $60-$70. All in all, the Hyatt Regency DFW was fine for what we needed and although it is nothing spectacular, we would stay there again. The staff was very professional and we had no negative experiences to report.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a lay over”
Reviews.Author: JOP1_10
Reviews.Content: After missing a connection to My final destination, I was advised that my best and quickest chance of getting to where I was going was to take a somewhat circuitous route from LAX to Dallas and stay overnight in Dallas for a very early flight the next day. After checking TripAdvisor I was disappointed to find that the Grand Hyatt at DfW was fully booked. The next option was the Hyatt Regency. As I landed at 9.30pm, it was wicked hot and I had no idea of how frequently the shuttle ran, I hopped in a cab and for $7.00 (money well spent in my book) I arrived at the GH approximately 5 minutes later. Yes it is super close to Terminal D. A speedy check in was provided. The room was above average and comfortable. As I was literally using the room as a place to shower and sleep, I didn't try the restaurants or room service. Express check out and a shuttle that runs every 20mins starting on the hour, had me back at the airpot in just a few minutes. Very friendly bell boys, concierge and drivers. I am not sure that the hotel is sound proofed - I could still hear planes, which is probably hardly surprising given that the hotel is right on the edge of a runway! No free wi- fi which I always find seriously irritating. Overall, would recommend if you find yourself having to take a room for just a few hours at DFW as you wait for a connection.

Reviews.Title: “very happy”
Reviews.Author: Maureen264
Reviews.Content: great service, beautiful clean, modern hotel close to JFK memorial/book store etc. breakfast was really good and all staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay here”
Reviews.Author: donna k
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful, clean hotel. I was so disappointed in the service. I went to the Hyatt website to book 2 rooms. I chose the sleep, park and fly plan as we had an extremely early flight to Vegas. I made the reservation the night before we got there. When we arrived, we were told that they no longer had that package, but if we wanted we could park in the long term parking and shuttle back to the hotel. Our room rate was $135.00 for hotel and 3 days of parking, the regular toom rate was 109.00. I told them that I made the reservation just the night before on the Hyatt website, I was told that it was a third party website and that they had no control of that website. We asked for a refund, but was told that we couldn't get one because of the third pary website scam they were pulling, the rate was a guaranteed rate so no cancellaltion. The very polite trainee spoke with the manager on duty. They offered to let us pay an additional $75.00 and let us get a parking pass. They would not even give that offer to the other couple. They had to pay the airport parking rate for the trip which was 96.00. I was angry the whole night thinking about what a scam that this hotel was putting on. I have stayed with Hyatt many times and have always enjoyed their hotels and staff, I will stay at other Hyatt Hotels, but not at this one. I did not feel safe there as if the pull this kind of scam, what else would they do?

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing/Quite---Excelent Service!”
Reviews.Author: SeeDworld2
Reviews.Content: This is a very excellent hotel.....the rooms were large and very clean and comfortable but, be ware.....there is not a fridge or microwave in the rooms. This hotel is more for the business traveler --- you pay for computer access in the business center. We had a hard time trying to find the hotel because the GPS system could not pick up on the location. It is right in the center of the Airport so just follow the sign that says DFW terminal C. If you put in Hyatt Hotel (GPS) it will take you to the hotel Down town which is also a beautiful hotel. Overall Excellent Stay

Reviews.Title: “Great rate through hotwire at the last minute”
Reviews.Author: calinative09
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency exceeded my expectations. Usually hotels near the airport aren't the best. The decor of the lobby and the room as well as the cleanliness was excellent. The front desk staff were friendly, professional and efficient. Great price and great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wish parking was included”
Reviews.Author: Tradewinns
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, comfortable and clean room, quick and friendly shuttle service. They do offer a discounted rate for parking, but since you still have to take a shuttle you might as well stay off airport and get free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great facility to stay when flying out.”
Reviews.Author: TexasEunice
Reviews.Content: Everything was extremely nice. Heavenly comfortable bed. Shuttle was timely and courteous. Bar was friendly and offered snacks to go with your drinks. Would definately stay there again. EO, Pottsboro, TX

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place for Flyers”
Reviews.Author: Squamsey8
Reviews.Content: Not only was dropping off a rental car and having a shuttle to my early flight a great solution, but this hotel had it all. Great room and amenities, fantastic service, several dining options and an overall feeling of being spoiled topped the list. I'll never fight the night before hotel battle again. Especially with a rental car to return. I felt like royalty and slept like a Queen at this Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service is NOT a priority”
Reviews.Author: I_am_reviewing_you
Reviews.Content: Let me be blunt: 1. I had to call the hotel twice to get a shuttle to pick me up from terminal E of the airport. While the operator apologized for â€œforgettingâ€� to tell the driver after the 1st call, waiting at night for 48 minutes to get a 5 minute ride to the hotel is just plain bad service. 2. The outside of building is ugly. Think 1960â€™s, concrete block building. 3. No one at the front door to help with bags or the door. Maybe the shuttle driver could have pitched in and helped out? 4. Watch out, if you have a late flight that lands after midnight, there is no room service and no open restaurant. You have to settle for a day-old muffins and a bottle of water in the 24-hr. coffee bar. 5. The 3 year old â€œrenovatedâ€� rooms tried look trendy but failed in my opinion. This failure is partly due to being small and dark. The trendy furniture seemed shabby or worn. Only 2 good things to report here: 1. The room was quite, I did not hear outside noise in the hallway or from other rooms. 2. Mr. Gâ€™s restaurant. The food is above average (but so is the price) and it has a good drink selection.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for overnight stays in DFW airport”
Reviews.Author: jfmelle
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Regency DFW with my wife for one night as part of a longer trip from Brazil to Hawaii. We chose this hotel because the rate was quite good for a Hyatt, and it is located inside the airport area. If you don't want to go to the town, you can take the hotel shuttle or even walk from the airport to the hotel, depending on the airport terminal you are. In my case I rented a car because I needed to go to downtown Dallas. However it can be quite though to get to the hotel through the different airport roads when you are driving. You can actually see the hotel, but it can be hard to get there the first time you try. And the GPS didn't help at all (on the contrary). The hotel provided self-parking. The room is very quiet considering that you are inside the airport, and it is also quite spacious. Bed was comfortable, there was a good working desk and the rate I got had wifi included, at a good speed and reliable. Hotel had some different dining options. Definitely I would recommend for an overnight stay near/ at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: averagejoe75
Reviews.Content: Hard to believe this was a airport hotel. Had to book a last minute flight to Dallas for some meetings, and decided to burn up some points for a free stay here. Unfortunately, when I checked in there were not upgrades available, but I was still given a nice room on the top floor. This hotel is right inside the DFW complex, which makes it convenient for getting to and from the airport. However, because of this, you have to keep driviing in and out of the dfw complex with toll tickets that have to be "put in the computer system" each time you exit. But, and here is the real shocker considering this is not only an airport hotel, but also inside the airport complex--PARKING IS FREE!! However, other than that, no big problem with the location. Checkin was quick and friendly. Ashlyn at the front desk took the time to explain all fo the hotels features and made herself available for any problems and or needs. The rooms have all been relatively recetnly redone. So everything has a new and modern glaze/feel to it. New plush beds and bedding, big flat sceen, ipod dock and speakers, etc. The room certainly was comfortable, with not even the sound of jets taking off and landing making it inside to wake me up. However, from the outside, the hotel itself looks like it is from the 70s/80s. In fact, many of the details in the room remind you of this: the door to your room, the balcony, etc. You would think that if they spent that much money on redoing the hotel, they would look after the details. The hotel also had overpriced (of course) room service and restaurants on site, and the quality was only so-so. There was a pool I didn't use, as well as a gym. There was a good amount of table space for working, and although i was given free wifi-it was hit and miss. The bathroom was nice, but for crying out loud, you need a door to the shower--the water sprays everywhere! My trip was short, but I did enjoy the hotel. Not a brilliant Hyatt by any means, but probably one of the best airport hotels I've very stayed in. If I was in the area, I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome respite for a weary traveler”
Reviews.Author: wndrwmn71
Reviews.Content: I want to say up front that I haven't been to this hotel since June of 2007, but it's important that I let everyone know how hospitable the staff was. You see, I was heading back to Iraq from 2 (much needed) weeks back in the US. I'm glad I chose this hotel. I knew it would be just the place for me to relax and be pampered for a few more days before I headed back to the dust and dirt. Hyatt Regency, you didn't fail me. I expected a quiet stay and that's what I got. Your bar staff was more than happy to make sure what I ordered was to my liking. The room was exceptional, and the bed was one of the most comfortable I had been in. Maybe my opinion is a little biased; I have stayed in a few Hyatt Regencies before, so I knew what to expect, and you guys delivered. I just wanted you to know how much I enjoyed my stay. It made it that much easier to put my uniform and boots back on and head back to Iraq. KUDOS!

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant surprise, would recommend without hesitation”
Reviews.Author: CarstenW2
Reviews.Content: Life is full of surprises and our stay at this Hyatt was one of them: This is not your average airport hotel. Instead, service was top-notch, rooms were nice and clean, and everything about our stay was great. Check-in in particular was remarkably professional and personal. A great property!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Good hotel - will be back”
Reviews.Author: sm405
Reviews.Content: I rarely write reviews. Usually, I will write a review if a hotel is terrible...I never write a review if the hotel is simply "good", but I will write a review if a hotel was "extremely good" or amazing. This hotel was one of the extremely good ones. I was treated very well by the staff, including a nice room upgrade, which I've come to appreciate as a Hyatt Diamond member. Their service and hospitality were top notch. Check out and check in were very efficient, and the room was ready and available on arrival. The hotel is grand, especially for an airport hotel. The view of the runway from my room (and of the airport as a whole) was excellent, I enjoyed the balcony. I also liked the fact they had starbucks coffee in the room. My one disappointment was with the breakfast. I was promised prior to arrival that a particular item would be made without a certain ingredient that I'm allergic to. At breakfast, I was told that it would not be possible. I appreciated the honesty, (and would much rather be told its not possible, then to have the item prepared with the ingredient I'm allergic to), but it was disappointing. Overall however, a very good hotel. It is a good value for those who are flying into DFW. It is also a very good hotel for people simply driving to Dallas (as I did)....plus parking is free - a benefit I certainly appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to believe this is an airport hotel (in a good way)”
Reviews.Author: briantoronto
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night between flights, and was impressed. It is an older hotel but has had a very nice renovation recently. Rooms are large and modern. Bed was comfy and quiet (always good at airport hotels). My rate included breakfast, and I had the very complete buffet. Quick friendly shuttle service is available to all terminals, but you can walk to C if you don't have bags. One of the best airport hotels out there!

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite, Relaxing, Elegant Hotel by Grapevine Mills”
Reviews.Author: MelindaLongoria
Reviews.Content: This hotel is for those who enjoy flawless craftsmanship, esoteric pampering, and the finer things in life. My husband and I won this hotel on priceline and were traveling with our 5 month old son. At check-in we were offered a crib which we gladly accepted. Our room was filled with little extras that make your stay comfortable including: aroma therapy "ginger" bath accessories and even toothpaste. The crib was delivered almost immediately, along with a small bottle of shampoo for our baby. Each room has a small balcony; nice to open and receive the breeze or drink your coffee in the morning. The night we stayed the lightning was beautiful to watch. The king size bed was comfortable with down blankets and pillows. We ordered room service for breakfast; the locks & bagels with tomatoes & capers and cream for our in-room coffee. There is a $3.00 and 21% charge added. There was no microwave or fridge and internet was $10 for 24 hours. My only suggestion when staying here is to put your "privacy" card outside when you wake up in the morning. The maid knocked once and then immediately proceeded to enter the room. My husband was in his boxers and I was just out of the shower. Normally, a maid will knock and then listen for an answer but this one just came right in. The next morning we put our privacy card in the key hole and were not disturbed. All-in-all this was a relaxing stay. The pool was a tad on the cold side but the water was clean and there were plenty of towels. The dinner menu was quite high; around $40 average for one person so we didn't get to try that but maybe next time. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Airport!”
Reviews.Author: mainetoday
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night, as we were coming in from out of town and flying home out of DFW early the next AM. Rooms very spacious and clean. Beds were very comfortable. Bathroom was clean and well appointed. I did have a chance to use the fitness center and it was very clean, had good amount of equipment and plenty of clean towels. We had dinner and drinks in the lounge one night and the food was ok, typical bar food. BUT we had breakfast in the cafe in the AM, did the Breakfast buffett, and it was very good. Lot's of variety and good quality food w/ omelettes to order! Went out on the town that night and the concierge hooked us up with some ideas and free passes and got us a cab there and back. Even though this place is right at the airport, you do not hear any of the jets landing or taking off. I was very impressed with the sound proofing and it made for a great nights sleep! I would recommend this to anyone in town on business or pleasure and wanting a place to stay, very convenient to the airport and needing to fly out on American. If you are flying in or our on another airline, they will give you a free shuttle ride to those terminals, but they are not walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice by DFW airport”
Reviews.Author: drtravels
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a priceline bid. I found it to be a very nice hotel and decided to splurge on the steak house while there. Both the hotel and restaurant staff very very competent and helpful. Very good meal but expect to pay $40-50 for a dinner without drinks. The room was also very nice and deserving of the 4 star rating. I'll be returning in the future.

Reviews.Title: “What a value for what you get”
Reviews.Author: bendedi1
Reviews.Content: Location location location. I would recommend this hotel and would rate as one of my top stayed at hotels. The drinks were a little costly but everything was perfect. Immaculate. Photos attached to show you. I also don't think people calculate all the extras you get when you book at this hotel. Firstly you can choose a rate including full to order breakfast or buffet, whichever you desire included in the rate. The display was incredible. Everything looked and tasted wonderful. They even supplied us with toothpaste. Something I feel is a commonly forgotten item. I would strongly consider this hotel. We were on our way home from a cruise and I have to say our holiday ended with a pleasant stay at this Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Stuck in DFW during the Blizzard”
Reviews.Author: Wordman113
Reviews.Content: Got stuck at DFW during the big blizzard last month and got two nights at the Hyatt Regency for $260 a night the week of the Super Bowl. I felt lucky to get any room in town and the Hyatt Regency, while not cheap was certainly a nice hotel. Very much a "business traveller" type hotel, it was clean, spacious, and convenient to Terminal C at the airport. The one bellman seemed to be trying to rip me off saying that no rental cars were available at the airport at all because of the Super Bowl, but I should book a Town Car with a driver (who I think was a friend of his). I called the Hertz at the airport and they delivered a car for me with basically no notice. All in all, considering the circumstances, I could have done worse. The bell guy was irritating, and the hotel bar was pretty expensive. The buffet breakfast was also good, but not cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place if looking for something by DFW.”
Reviews.Author: KLYMn
Reviews.Content: We won this Hotel through Priceline. We did have an idea we would be at DFW airport which we were fine with. Not bad location especially for the travelers. Very close to Ft. Worth and Grapevine. Hotel is very nice!. If you travel in/out of the hotel they will stamp your TOLL card so your fare is covered. Parking is free here. They only have a swimming pool outdoors with no hottub. Also room has no fridge/microwave. Fitness room has treadmills,bikes,weights,water, and cold towels.

Reviews.Title: “Dedicated to customer service”
Reviews.Author: GSCSailing
Reviews.Content: We have had two banquets at the Hyatt Regency for our club. From the moment you pull up to the entrance to the moment you leave everyone makes you feel valued. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to hold a banquet or other event. The rooms are beautiful and comfortable as well.

Reviews.Title: “A very convenient stopover hotel”
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night to break our journey, having received a good rate on Hotwire, and were so pleased to arrive at the hotel after a much-delayed flight. Check in staff were exceptionally pleasant, and helpful with directions etc. Room was fine and very clean and comfortable, there was a great shower, and we slept well without any aeroplane noise to disturb us. Had a snack meal in the coffee shop type restaurant adjacent to the bar, food was very average and the server was rather over attentive, constantly interrupting our conversation to ask if we were enjoying our meal! That was the only negative thing about our stay and we would happily use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but would have rather stayed in town”
Reviews.Author: kamloopsbarbiegirl
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel online not knowing it was right inside airport. So if you want leave airport area you have to pay toll fee. Therefore anyone picking me up or dropping me off from hotel would have to pay fee. If you need to stay near airport this is a good location but if you want to have restaurants or shops around you or just go for a walk you shouldn't stay here. I felt a confined to the hotel because of the location. Overall hotel was nice and comfortable. The only complaint I had was location and price of snacks and bottle water. Since there is nothing close by you have to pay really high prices for things like a gum or water. If you stay here make sure you stock up.

Reviews.Title: “overnight stop at airport”
Reviews.Author: johnpg2
Reviews.Content: In general a good transit hotel for a one night stopover. Found the coach to the hotel and it was quite prompt,Portarage was good and explained my room setup,I had upgraded my room for extra $35 but i expected more,I had ordered some things for the room like beer as the flight was dry and i was gasping for some shiner bok,also extra pillows for 16-00pm that day. The bar was good with good selections of draft beer and bottled european brands very good service and i had dinner at the bar which was also good,Breakfast had a good choice hot and cold for $15 so cant complain about the price Outside pool was to cold to use for November but in general a good stopover hotel for the night. This hotel is no good if you want to see the night life in Dallas or Fort/worth because of its 25 miles to each also the cost of a cab $75 to the stockyards for my next hotel also a hyatt i would say the hotel is overpriced for what i paid for the night even with upgrade $280

Reviews.Title: “Doubled charge for my stay !!!”
Reviews.Author: msynder
Reviews.Content: I spend 3 nights in Hyatt Regensy DFW hotel. My company pays for my stay. During check in I gave my master card (just for security). During check out my card was not charged, but month later I got information that also my card was chargd 662.72U$. This way me stay in this hotel was charged twice. I write several times climing this situation, but nobody answered my mails !! Marek Synder, Poland

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hyatt property”
Reviews.Author: EarnyinLA
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night during a layover to ORD the next morning. I believe you have to call for the shuttle late at night but luckily it arrived several minutes after waiting at the hotel shuttle area from terminal D. Checkin was smooth and recognized my Platinum status even though I had reserved the room through a bidding site which allowed me free internet access. Room was clean and quiet. The lobby restaurant/bar seemed busy that night. I didn't have time to check out the rest of the property as I had a flight early in the morning. I tried to use the self checkout machine in the lobby but was not successful. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MDavisTucson_AZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on an overnight on our way home from vacation. We had a great room rate that included breakfast. The hotel is off Consourse C at DFW Airport, very clean lobby area, spotless rooms and nice bathroom and room layout. The bed was very comfortable w/ ultra soft linens. The lobby bar had good service for a snack and a glass of wine. Breakfast the next morning was really good and a nice selection of fresh fruits, eggs, cereal, etc and excellent coffee. Front desk personnel were professional and friendly. There is a shuttle to and from the airport every 20 minutes or so. I would highly recommend this hotel if you have to stay overnight at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: Cunningham19
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night, it was great. It was great location, there was plenty to do inside hotel and close by. I would stay there again if I went back. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Weekend”
Reviews.Author: LIVELAUGHLOVE30
Reviews.Content: We were pleased with our stay at the Hyatt Regency DFW. The staff was courteous the room was recently renovated. Check in was a smooth transaction. The room was clean (passed the hair test). Attended the Dallas Cowboy game and after the lost it was a pleasure to return to the room and relax. I would recommend and plan to stay again when we return. Thanks Hyatt!

Reviews.Title: “BRAVO!!”
Reviews.Author: Kybosh77
Reviews.Content: Worth every penny...you name it..convenience, polite staff, impeccable room, prompt shuttle TO and FRO!!...Bravo Hyatt Regency DFW keep up the good work...........Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Wow! with a few minor things....”
Reviews.Author: Densonfamily
Reviews.Content: Hotel is beautiful inside, very WOW! Hotel staff from valets to front desk are incredibly kind. 2-queen room was comfortable, bathroom was nice size, elevators were fast and quiet. Just 10 minutes north of the airport is Grapevine, TX where there are plenty of restaurants and shopping. There is even a shuttle bus that will come pick you up and bring you back to the hotel. The pool is outdoors and it can be noisy with the planes and cars, but was always well stocked with towels and was fun for the kids. No spa, but the workout room was excellent. The few minor things that I didn't like: 1 - NO FREE INTERNET -it costs $10 a day? Come on! 2 - No guest laundry - I really hate wet swimsuits in the room all night. 3 - Pool is located far across the large lobby from the elevators, so my family of five drip, drip, dripped all over the tile floor. I felt terrible for leaving water drops everywhere especially since there was a formal ball about to begin and we had to walk through the guests. So sorry, we did use towels... just a bad site plan for that particular combination of events. My kids loved waking up and seeing the planes right outside the window and it was a really nice place to stay, but it is almost too fancy for my family!

Reviews.Title: “Needs new TOWELS!”
Reviews.Author: kingair005
Reviews.Content: The hotel accomodation were good but I was not happy with the quality of the towels in the bathroom. These were Best Western or Motel 6 quality. Maybe they are just old. I would have expected when they remodeled that the towels would be upgraded as well. The other linens were great. Saw repairs being done to elevator doors and very clean everywhere.
