The food was expensive but well presented. Fitness center was excellent. 8 aerobic devices, 4 bikes, full weight set and television hookups. Clean and bright.

Reviews.Title: “Just Know What You Are Getting Into”
Reviews.Author: Phillip66
Reviews.Content: Pros- The rooms are wonderful, fast elevators, beautiful ball room and meeting space. Unbelievable staff... really fresh young and polite people running the place. This is a lovely hotel. Jacob's Grill is a terrific restaurant... I mean impeccable. Aces bar is a blast. Just know that this is a very unique arrangement. Google map it just to get an idea of where you are.. You are sequestered in an airport terminal. You cannot walk anywhere outdoors. You are in a concrete complex. Just know that. The CON and I seem to run into this in Dallas. Bad wireless connectivity in an airport hotel is a MAJOR CON. This hotel has horrible wireless access in your room. If you need wireless access... stay somewhere else. When I mentioned it to the desk they gave me an awkward device to hook up to my laptop, saying it would improve my connection. No such luck. But..... The ambience and amenities were so terrific... I would love to stay there again... i will just make sure I do not need wireless connectivity next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good For Early Morning Flights”
Reviews.Author: foodisourpassion
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is near Terminal C, but you still need to take a shuutle to get to all of the various terminals. Shuttle buses leave every 20 minutes, so to the time you save is only the from the proximity of off airport hotels, which are not close.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel For Business or Early Morning Flights. No Skylink Here Though.”
Reviews.Author: MG_SANTACRUZ
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well suited for a business traveler that needs to stay near the airport or a family that needs to make an early morning departure from DFW. Don't be confused by the name of the hotel, the DFW Skylink does NOT connect to this hotel. It does connect to the Grand Hyatt which is actually further away from the airport, but made seemingly closer by the Skylink. We walked from the airport to the hotel. It was no problem the path is through the parking structure outside the 'C' Concourse, well lit, well marked, easy walk. In fact, if you are flying in and out of the C Concourse walking to the hotel is probably faster than taking the Skylink to the Grand Hyatt. It appears this hotel has a newly renovated interior. Rooms are modern, clean, and comfortable. Showers and bathrooms are great. I give the restaurant and bar in the lobby good marks. The food was good. The servers were very friendly and tried to accommodate the travelers that came in right at closing time, myself included. I do wish they had late night restaurants as I often arrive in Dallas around 11pm. They do have an all night coffee service in the lobby. You can buy very basic snacks and drinks from an attendee at a register. That's as good as it gets after midnight. It's nice to have airline information digitally displayed in the lobby and there is a complimentary shuttle that will take you back to the airport in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient transit stay”
Reviews.Author: NinaKrohn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency DFW on our way from Trinidad to Vancouver in April 2010. Prior to our arrival I called in to ask how long in advance I could have a Amazon Package sent to the hotel, since we wanted to buy our own baby crib for our daughter for this trip. The lady on the phone was pretty bothered, it seemed, and the question was not really answered in the end. So I just ordered, and fortunately we received the package just fine. We had a room with a Kingsize Bed, which was really nice and confy. I slept heavenly in that bed, like in all Hyatt beds. We were told upon arrival that there was a heated outside pool on the property, which we wanted to use, since our baby daughter loves dipping in the pool. Unfortunately we had to find out that the water was ice cold and the area around the pool so slippy (no signs nowhere) that I slipped out, with my baby on my arm, and fell badly. The baby wasn't hurt, but it wasn't a nice experience neither. By the way, the highway is right across from the pool... The restaurant on the property serves very nice food. Staff is nice (never met the lady from the phone there). The airport shuttles are operating every 20 minutes, which is good, so they are not too crowded and you always have a chance to get to the airport on time. If I ever have to transit in Dallas again, I would check back into this hotel. I would also recommend it to anybody who has to stay overnight near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to be trapped...but trapped you are. Beware of the expense report.”
Reviews.Author: brmusicman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in April, 2010 for a variety of business meetings, including a couple at the hotel. The hotel's facilities were fantastic: stylish lobby; roomy guest rooms with great design, wonderful and flexible desk area, and comfortable bedding; and a huge conference center that appeared to be recently renovated and avoided some of the typical hotel-ballroom-blandness by having several locally-themed displayed on Texas businesses and leaders that were actually pretty interesting. The fitness center was great: a wide range of cardio equipment and free weights, open 24-hours, nice towels, even a wine refrigerator filled with cool towels to use post-workout! I was very impressed with the physical plant of the hotel; it's significantly nicer than its 1980s-looking exterior would suggest and certainly was a refreshing change-of-pace from usually design-less airport hotels I've stayed at in other cities. Service-wise, I had a mixed experience. I had dinner at the fancy steakhouse in the hotel; the service was superb. The front desk and housekeeping service was good. The meetings staff seemed to do a good job. I had a more mixed experience in the business center, where the staff was laughably inflexible. I had dinner in the restaurant off the lobby one night, and the service there was horrible -- I waited forever to be taken to a table, and once at the table my server was slow and disinterested. Nothing is more frustrating than watching the staff be more concerned about re-setting the tables for breakfast than it is about clearing your food or bringing something out while it's still warm. The hotel is attached to DFW's parking garages. There's nothing nearby -- all restaurants, stores, etc. are either within security at DFW or outside of the (huge) airport complex (WAY beyond walking distance). So, in one sense, the location is very convenient, as no other hotel (except the other Hyatt) is on the airport's grounds. The downside, though, is that the on-airport location means that the hotel has you trapped when it comes to services and meals. It knows this...even though the room rate was reasonable, everything else was NOT. The most ridiculous was the business center, where computer access to print cost a minimum of $9.00 (plus a certain amount per page). An envelope cost money, as did copies, etc. I had some documents to copy that were sort of complicated (i.e., some pages needed to be copies, others didn't; some had to be blown up, others shurnk), and it was my strong preference to do the copying myself. The staff in the business center initially wouldn't allow me to do that, saying they couldn't be liable if I were injured by the copy machine. Come on. When I promised not to sue they agreed to let me make the copies so long as the business center associate stood next to me; this showed me that they were less concerned with liability and more concerned with nickel-and-diming me. I bet they sure are glad they didn't miss out on one chance to charge me $.10. The restaurant prices were also absurd. There is an a la carte, classic steakhouse attached to the hotel. It was a lovely meal, and a very nice restaurant at which you expected the prices to be elevated to match the quality of the service...but the prices were crazy expensive; it was nearly $100/person for a salad, entree, and glass of wine (and that was ordering with caution!). The regular restaurant wasn't that crazy, but my chicken breast entree was $26 -- add a salad and an iced tea, and you're talking a $40 dinner. The coffee bar's prices were similarly high. So, being connected to DFW is very convenient...but you PAY for that convenience! Overall, absent the bad experience in the restaurant and the bean counter in the business center, the hotel was very nice, but the hidden costs were higher than normal. So, balance the great facility and desire of being connected to DFW with the off-airport properties that are less expensive and have access non-hotel owned stores, restaurants, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: CruiseWhere
Reviews.Content: This is the first hotel that I have ever set foot in that when I checked in and requested a King Bed I was told "I certainly think we can do that". And the reason I am saying this is that usually when you purchase a room on Priceline you are usually treated as a second class citizen all due in part to how much you have paid for your room. More importantly this hotel treated us as their guest.!!!! Frankie checked us in with all the courtesies that you would expect from being a full price paying guest and was truly genuine!!1 Thank you Frankie!!! The rooms are comfortable, trendy and very very new and clean. The more we stay at Hyatts the more they are becoming our preferred hotel accomodation. I also must mention that we dined at Mister G in the hotel.... beyond fabulous!! From cheese garlic bread with sliced almonds to our Caesar Salad created at our table, to our tender and flavourful steaks no one could as for more!!! Thank you!!!! Keep up the great work!!!!

Reviews.Title: “This property doesn't recognize its elite members”
Reviews.Author: banjo518
Reviews.Content: Being a highest-tier Diamond member, I booked a one-night stay for my brother-in-law who had an early AM flight out of DFW. Only upgraded my room by one level, a deluxe King with a sofa bed. Other than then, they ignored every one of my request: upper floor, away from elevator. I dropped by in the morning to see if I could check ini early. Answer was no, so I reiterated my room requests. By the time we returned in the evening, they gave me a room on the 6th Floor (not high floor considering the hotel is 14-story high) and right NEXT to the elevator overlooking the parking garage! When I called the front desk, I was told the hotel was sold out and nothing else available. What the hell? If I ever need to stay near DFW, I'd try the Grand Hyatt instead of this muckhole.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Regency-One of Two Hyatts at DFW”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrierMD
Reviews.Content: Stayed here overnight on our way down to Mexico, and at the Grand Hyatt DFW on the way back. The Hyatt Regency hotel is on the airport grounds, about a five minute shuttle ride from the terminal. They picked us up promptly, and the shuttle leaves every 20 minutes from the hotel back to the terminals. The property is renovated/updated, and the rooms are large and fairly quiet for an airport hotel. Service was very good. Overall, a very good experience, particularly for an airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You could not ask for more”
Reviews.Author: luckiestguyalive
Reviews.Content: Top notch facilities. I just held my wedding here, and the sevice was above and beyond all expectations. The staff here are true experts in their feilds. The enviroment was emaculate, the food was outstanding, and the rooms are breathtaking. I honestly can't remember the last time I was this impressed by a business. Peggy is the event coordinator there, she is one of the nicest people, very professional, and very easy to work with. She really worked hard to make the night perfect. I would give the hotel 10 out of 5 stars if I could

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for layover”
Reviews.Author: BeachChair
Reviews.Content: Three minute shuttle ride from baggage claim since it's "on campus." Modern/Clean Hyatt rooms. Really quiet for being at the airport. Shuttle back to airport ran every 20 mins. like clockwork.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD ROOMS, TRANSPORTATION EXPENSIVE”
Reviews.Author: CLP5
Reviews.Content: Our group stayed here for a conference, and it was ok. The rooms are newly re-done with a clean modern look. There is a charge for internet access, and it took me three attempts to get some laundry picked up. But the customer service was good- they paid for my laundry since it was their fault it never got picked up. The bad part was getting a taxi or car for getting around. It is a baseline charge of 23$ (!) to get a taxi anywhere; this is due to some rules aobut the hotel being on airport property. We all wished we had rented a car, but the hotel charges 25$/day to keep it there. The hotel restaurants are ok, but we headed out for dinner most times which usually meant at least a 15min drive somewhere. Again, the hotel itself is nice. There is no spa here.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient for airport travel”
Reviews.Author: misseattle
Reviews.Content: Great location at the airport if you want an in and out experience with no hassel. The shuttle comes every 10 minutes or so, and the driver was very friendly. Room service menu was pretty limiting, and VERY pricey. However, if you do room service, you must try the ice cream sundae - very delicious!! The rooms are pretty basic, and could use a reburbishment, but nice overall. They also have tiny little balconies which is good for us smokers.

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: hopkinssr
Reviews.Content: it was smooth . the price was great and it worked great for being close to where we were flying out of

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - much better than you would expect to find at an airport”
Reviews.Author: CSL63
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for my wife's high school reunion, and had a wonderful time! We were a little surprised to find out that the hotel where the reunion was being held was actually at DFW, but once we got to the hotel, we were pleasantly surprised. The great service started with the valet, who kept our car for 20-30 minutes with no charge (valet is normally $25 per day) while we checked in and quickly cleaned up before going out. He also pointed out that, while he would love to park our car for us, there was free parking in the garage, and he told us how to get there. The line at check-in happened to be long when we drove in, but that was because there had been a bad storm the day before, and there were about 50 flights that were canceled, so people were scrambling to find a room. The long line was not a problem, though, as the efficient front desk staff moved very quickly and handled us in short order. The bellman got us and our luggage up to our room very quickly in the service elevator, since the guest elevators were completely overwhelmed right then. That is one downside to the hotel - apparently it's very popular with conventions, and there was a large teen convention during the week, resulting in a long wait for the elevators until the group checked out early Saturday morning. The room is very clean and must have been remodeled recently. The furnishings are all modern and sleek - very comfortable without being cold. The king bed was comfortable, and there is a work desk on wheels with a desk chair, a chair with ottoman, and another side chair. The TVs are 32" LCD, with a typical array of cable channels and PPV. The remodeling apparently cost $50 million, and the rooms were just completed within the last couple of years. The work that was done appears to be more than just the superficial paint and new TV - the entire room was redone, and the bathrooms and entry way was remodeled as well - tiles, fixtures, counter, sink - everything. It looks like a new hotel, not just a retouching a tired old hotel. The bathroom is divided up with the sink area, with a closet, and a separate shower / toilet area. The show has a half glass wall - no curtain - but is very roomy - it takes up the same area as the tub that was undoubtedly removed previously. There is a small balcony outside of a sliding door. Our view was of the airport over the parking garage - don't know if there are any really good views because you're at the airport. Opening it does bring in some outside air, but it also brings in the outside noise. It does help you realize how good a job the door does at keeping the airport noise out, though - you really have to be listening for the airplanes to notice them when the door is closed. The hotel has all the amenities you would expect from a large convention hotel - pool, fitness center, bar, several restaurants, gift shop, ATM machine, free boarding pass printout at the front desk. The wireless internet is $10.77 per day (maybe that works out to a round number with tax?), but if you join the Hyatt Gold Passport club then the internet is free. One note if you're driving - there is a toll to enter the airport. Make sure you bring your toll ticket into the hotel, and they will validate it for you - even if you don't valet park.

Reviews.Title: “Early flight out? Don't waste your time elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: PARebob
Reviews.Content: Although not a 5 star destination hotel, you'd be hard put to find a better place to stay before an early flight out of DFW. The staff is gracious and attentive, the rates are quite reasonable for a hotel of this quality, and the facilities are kept in exceptional shape. One of those places where you won't hesitate to walk around barefoot in your room - in fact the carpet was actually quite plush and felt nice on the toes. It was our first stay here, but we won't hesitate to stay again next time. The room was even quiet - didn't expect that staying AT the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at DFW Airport”
Reviews.Author: txn
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Hyatt Regency probably four or five times in the past seven years and once again, it is a winner. It is located at DFW airport which makes it a great location if you have an early flight or a layover at DFW. My son and I were on our way to San Francisco and had a layover at DFW. I called Hotels.com and was able to get a rate of $79/night for two queen beds. The hotel shuttle gets you to and from the airport quickly. The shuttle leaves the hotel for the terminals every 20 minutes, 24 hours a day, which makes it very convenient. Our room was very nice with comfortable beds. The bathroom is set up well with the sink area separate from the bathtub/toilet area, which enables two people to use it at a time. There are a couple of dining options at the hotel which we didn't use. There is also a gift shop area where you can buy sodas and candy as well as gift items. I will plan on staying at the Hyatt Regency DFW next time I need to stay near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “All in one”
Reviews.Author: SWMDL60
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night before flying back home. You have at least two options to get there from any DFW airport terminal. Option 1: find the hotel courtesy phone and call for the hotel van. Option 2: Hop on the Skylink to terminal C and walk to the hotel â€“ you have to walk through two parking structures with some steps so if you have small children, heavy luggage, or on a wheel chair, I donâ€™t recommend this. We just had carry-on bags so we walked to and from terminal C. Upon arrival, a very efficient check-in receptionist greeted us â€“ Meredith. We remember her name because she wrote down her name on the room key card cover and told us to contact her for any assistance that we may need. The room had a chic yet simple dÃ©cor. There was a mobile desk but there wasnâ€™t much room to move it elsewhere. Wi-Fi was offered with a fee ($10.77 for 24 hour use) but if you just want to log in to print out your boarding pass, there is a boarding pass printer you can use at the lobby (just like a boarding pass printer machine in the airport). The shampoo they had was good but it was a bit too fragrant for me. The in-room coffee maker was the type you make one cup at a time and brewed pretty good coffee. There were two water bottles (not refrigerated) were available for $4 each. A clock/radio/iPod station combo machine was available but I couldnâ€™t figure out how to use it as AM radio so it must be just FM only radio. We dined at Mr. Gâ€™s in the hotel and dropped off around $250 - dinner, wine and dessert for two. My husband gave it his file mignon a five star and my lobster bisque was rich and buttery - we were stuffed. Service was attentive and friendly. We opted for Jets (cafÃ©) and bought some pastries for breakfast. My husband said his lemon pound cake was dry but my chocolate filled croissant was fresh and was great with a cup of coffee brewed in the room. Because of its location, airplane noises are unavoidable during the day but later and earlier in the day, there was no plane noise to disturb you. We were planning to go swimming before check out but chose to spend lazy morning in the bed instead. Great location, staff, room, and food â€“ all in one here.

Reviews.Title: “Hearty Endorsement”
Reviews.Author: JKTexas
Reviews.Content: I love this Hotel and stay here frequently (room photos on Hyatt are accurate (minus the plants in the room)). What set's this hotel apart? 1-Every room has a balcony. If you are an indoor worker, you appreciate getting "fresh" air on occasion. With balconies in every room, it is easy to open the door -though it can be noisy, and can be smelly (depends on the wind -Jet A fumes). If you like aviation though, these concerns are negated because this is an awesome place to watch aviation. Once you shut the door though, most sounds are cut off though you can hear the larger planes taking off with the door shut on occasion. 2 - Shower and bathroom -No tubs or shower curtains here (unless you do get one of the tub rooms). That is a huge difference if you are used to a shower at home. The bathroom is nice, large, and upscale. You will not get the cramped feeling. And the commode and sink area are separated by a door. A very nice bonus is the shower head. Other - rooms are sized right and are nicely decorated, though there are some cramped ones depending on where your room is. All rooms have ihome clock radios- a nice touch. Nice workspace - on the order of Marriott, but it is nice that the desk swivels out. There is also a big easy chair with ottoman - I know some Marriott rooms have sofa's but the easy chair is a nice place to sit- nicer than the chairs at Marriott. Workout facility is very nice. I am not an expert on work-out rooms though since I prefer to exercise outside (and this is a negative to this hotel since it is in the middle of the airport). However, there are multiple, high quality treadmills and other high quality equipment (stair climbers, bikes, and weight machines) in a very nice, comfortable facility with towels (available in a towel warmer), fruit and cold water. TV's (on different channels) line the walls and the equipment have built in TV's too. Concerns -This is obviously a convention hotel. Conventions can make the hotel noisy and crowded, but if you aren't going to spend a lot of time in the public spaces, you will never notice it if you are in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ebbs83
Reviews.Content: Last year after our wedding, we checked into the Hyatt at the airport because we had a flight the next day to Las Vegas. The hotel decor in the lobby was nice and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Our bedroom was great and clean. We also was able to have a free breakfast the morning of our flight. I would greatly recommend this hotel if you are catching a flight.

Reviews.Title: “Great property right at the airport”
Reviews.Author: bubbafb
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency (not to be confused with the Grand Hyatt) is across the parking area from DFW (concourse C). There is a shuttle that can take you from and to the other concourses. I was arriving late to DFW and this was a perfect choice. The Hyatt properties ard typically great and this is no exception. Nice lobby, good restaurant (believe called Mister G's), a coffee bar with Starbucks products and a sports bar. The room was great - clean, comfortable, nice sized HD TV. Some of the staff was disappointing. Our reservation was messed up and it took a while to straighten it out and even the next morning they struggled and were not overly helpful. The wait staff in the coffee bar and restaurant were good. I think the bellman steered us wrong with suggestion a car service over a taxi (it was $65 to downtown Fort Worth area and I think that was more than a cab. Anyway, it is recommended if you don't want to leave the airport. Take note: there is not a sign that I could find for the Hyatt Regency and you either need to walk to concourse C - around gate 21 and take a skybridge over (which was a bit dark and may not be recommended) or leave any concourse and catch a shuttle (better option).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hyatt!”
Reviews.Author: travelguy1205
Reviews.Content: While the Hyatt Regency was built in the late seventies once you step inside it appears brand new. The interior styling could almost be described as "boutique". Customer service and employee attention to detail were unmatched. Fitness center and pool are what you would expect at a five star hotel. Rooms are huge and soundproof. Never knew I was at the airport unless I opened the balcony door. Highway access is great if you are traveling throughout Dallas. But if you only have business in one part of the city the location may not be that convenient. My only complaint would be the the wireless connection. First, it was not complimentary (10.99 per day) nor easy to access with Firefox. I guess since parking is free it was a trade off. I would stay here again and recommend to others. Oh, and the pool is open year round and felt heated to 80 degrees. This is a great Hyatt!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Surprise”
Reviews.Author: MonkeyGreen
Reviews.Content: After missing a connection American put me up in this hotel. Not to be confused with the Grand Hyatt, this is the older Hyatt in terminal C. What a pleasant surprise this was. The property has undergone a total remodel and is way bettter than expected. The rooms have a "W" hotel feel, huge flat screen TVs, new comfy beds and the decor is first rate. The only drawback to the property is that it is quite a walk from the terminal, although they do have a shuttle. I would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for over night and early flights”
Reviews.Author: GEW925
Reviews.Content: My most recent stay at Hyatt Regency, DFW was the best stay I have had there. Like all other times, this stay was so I could catch an early flight the next morning. Being on the airport premises, it takes very few minutes for the hotel shuttle to arrive at the gate. When making reservations, I paid the rate for a normal "King", but when checking in, I was told that I had been upgraded to a King Deluxe; thus I was Suprised at the size of the room when entering it. the room has a 7 ft. couch and the bed had 5 or 6 pillows on it. Likewise, the bathroom was large. It does not have a tub, but a shower only. the shower stall is the length of a tub and has a stabble plexiglass wall half the length of a tub. This hotel has a restroom on the patio beside the pool which is very convenant for the guest. I have stayed there many times and will continue to do so in the future. GEW

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kenyonmartin2003
Reviews.Content: Ok -- its an airport hotel. The airport is far from most things in Dallas. Other than that -- which you knew already -- because it is the Hyatt Regency DFW (which gave it away) -- is a great hotel. Great rooms; flat screen TV. The shower may or may not have a door -- I wasnt sure if it was me or post modern. It was 135 per night -- and perfect for what i needed. If you have a car and need to use the aiport as base its a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but you will hear some airport noise”
Reviews.Author: travelon1
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Priceline and got it for $45 a night. I arrived late and it called the hotel from a courtesy phone. It took about ten minutes for the shuttle to arrive. The shuttle driver was friendly. At check in I requested a room facing away from the runway and was accomodated. The room was typical four star quality and had a comfy bed and flat screen HD TV. The only thing I did not like about the room was the shower that was not fully enclosed and let in too much cold air. The restaurant prices were outrageous. Pancakes were thirteen dollars and some dinners were fifty. Bring muffins with you like I did because there is no place else to eat in the area. Although I did not face the runway I did hear some distant runway noise and traffic from the roadway below. Luckily it was pretty quiet from midnight to about five. By the way, parking is free if you get your ticket validated at the front desk and you pay when you leave the airport grounds.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: yakarobed
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two night stay at the Hyatt Regency inside DFW. When I won the bid of $53 per night through Priceline, I had mixed emotions because it was inside the airport and I was hoping for the Westin. Honestly, it wasn't much of a hassle being in the airport after learning our way around. We checked in late Friday night with only about a five minute wait. It would have been longer but another check-in line was opened when the line began forming. The staff was very friendly and welcoming and felt I received the same consideration had I paid full price ($129 per night). The room was a nice size with a king sized bed, 32" flat screen TV and desk. There is a small balcony and the sliding door actually opens! (Emphasis on small!) The bathroom has a shower only with a glass half-wall and no door on the shower. I know that is the new "spa" thing, but I would not want it at home. Water splashes outside the shower, plus, it doesn't get warm in the shower! Shampoo, conditioner & bath soap provided was good, Portico bath products. A small, single cup coffee maker is provided along with enough coffee for three cups. There is a powerful hairdryer with probably the shortest cord I've ever had on a hairdryer, but it was ok. There's also an iron and ironing board in the closet. There were about 10 hangers and an extra blanket and pillow on the shelf. The bed. Oh, what a wonderful bed. I thought I had the perfect pillowtop mattress at home, but I was wrong. We slept wonderfully both nights. I believe there were three regular sized pillows and two king sized. All were just the right amount of fluffiness for us both if you used two pillows. Noise. There was none. It is hard to believe how quiet the rooms are when there are jets taking off all around you. There was one time when the TV was off and all was quiet and I heard a take-off. Barely. I was standing close to the balcony door at the time. Other than that, it was as quiet as could be. We had breakfast Jacob's Spring Grille our first morning. It was your typical breakfast buffet and had made-to-order omelettes. A bit pricey at nearly $50 with tip. It was a wonderful stay and I can't wait to stay with them again. Many Pros, including: Free self-parking Friendly staff Remodeled rooms Only one Con: Charge for internet access

Reviews.Title: “A Real Winner”
Reviews.Author: County-Hunter
Reviews.Content: My family and I had a great one night stand here. The rooms are fabulous with flat screen TV's and brand new furniture. And I do mean room(s). The electronic lock to our first room broke locking us out and the staff had to send up a maintenance person to fix it. We got locked out of our rooms again and the staff moved us to a second room. The hotel manager came up to check on us and apologized profusely. To compensate us for our troubles, he authorized free internet access (normally $10 a night) and had a bowl of fruit and water sent up to our room. How nice. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very close to DFW!”
Reviews.Author: GEOFFS3
Reviews.Content: This is definetly a nice place......and being newly renovated is a great thing. LOCATION- If you need a hotel near DFW Airport, this is your place. You can't get much closer. It's possible to walk, but the easier solution is the quick shuttle ride. We waited less than 10 minutes before we were at the hotel. (Please note that the GRAND HYATT DFW, also at the airport is on the airport train route and even easier). However, f you have business outside of the airport this would be a very awkward location. SERVICE- Very professional and crisp looking staff. You definetly feel like you are in an upper-tier hotel. However, I think I may have caught them on a bad night when they were very full. There was quite a line at the front desk. And when I called both the phone operator with a question and room service, I had to wait quite a while before someone answered. However I must say, everyone was very friendly and professional. ROOMS- Absolutely beautiful. One of the prettiest and most lush "chain" hotel rooms I have been in. I was very impressed. Very modern, but also warm at the same time. I think have have done up Marriott as far as the level of luxury. Gorgeous color scheme and a huge plasma tv. The bathroom was equally impressivve with beautiful tile work and lovely amenities. Only two small negatives: The towel quality did however seem a bit chincy (too thin) for such a nice room. Also, the bathroom lighting was a bit harsh. BAR- I didn't have time to stop in, but there was a lobby bar that was hopping for sure. It was gorgeously decorated and looked like fun! For an airport hotel, this place is great. Certainly not cheap but you are getting a very nice room.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but...”
Reviews.Author: pjscout
Reviews.Content: First the good features... This hotel is so close to the airport. The interior is lovely. It is modern, sleek and so air conditioned. The pool, with both good and bad features, is clean and maintained well. The bell boys (is that the proper term?) are friendly and helpful. Despite being so close to the runway the rooms are quiet. They are also spacious and clean. Now the bad... They charge you to use the shuttle and the wireless. Both things that the average traveler want to use. The front desk staff is a bit cold and rude. When my keys REPEATEDLY failed to work they did not want to let me into my room, even with ID, as the room was registered in my husband's name. Seriously. They are responsible for the lousy card keys and for knowing who I am as I was right there on check in and they gave me a key at that time. If they wanted my name they could have asked for it. They wanted me to wait for my husband to come back from a meeting to let me in. I got mad and they relented but why make me get mad about it. Then they thought a fruit platter would make it better. The food is marginal in general. The pool has no bar service and is noisy with car overpasses and airplanes.

Reviews.Title: “Nice looking”
Reviews.Author: Traveler075
Reviews.Content: This hotel has undergone an extensive renovation and looks beautiful. The rooms are very tastefully decorated. However, the A/C is noisy and takes a long time to cool the room. The sink drains slowly. The alarm clock looks nice, but is hard to set. If you need to stay at DFW, and can afford it, its certainly a decent hotel--but the renovations focussed on looks and not more practical items.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, clean hotel for a weary traveler”
Reviews.Author: MalibuStace
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the Hyatt last minute on Priceline and it was a fabulous deal. The room was clean and very comfortable. Room service was prompt, tasty, fresh and nicely presented. If I hadn't had a meeting (at the other Hyatt which looked nice but not worth the extra money) I would not have wanted to leave my room. It was such a comfy oasis coming off a plane. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend getaway for the price!”
Reviews.Author: mckinneycarters
Reviews.Content: We wanted to get out of our comfort zone for Memorial Day weekend but still be close enough to Grandma's where Baby Girl was staying, just in case.... put in "4 stars" on Priceline-Name Your Own Price, and we got a winner! VERY NICE room for half the rack price and staff was VERY FRIENDLY. The rooms are well described in other's reviews so I'll just add two negatives: the bed was made with FLAT SHEETS ONLY (the Hyatt can't afford to use fitted sheets on their highly promoted Hyatt beds?) and the shower was a half-door walk-in SHOWER ONLY (be sure to put down the bath mat!) so taking a bath is not possible. The room was clean, but we were surprised to see our neighbor's room service trays out in the hallway for almost 24 hours. Be sure to try the Bananas Foster for Two at Jacob's Spring Grille - it's huge and delicious, but don't get caught hungry enough to pay $7.50 for a chicken salad sandwich at JETT'S coffee shop! Use the coasters in the vanity area for a free dessert and an upsize Starbuck's to get more bang for your buck. Also, the breakfast buffet was very good (great omelettes and Belgian waffles), but O.J. is an exorbitant extra charge not included in the $15 price. The pool has towel service for a few hours, but once the towels rung out, you have to ask the front desk to send more. Don't forget to have your airport PARKING VOUCHER VALIDATED coming and going and if you have a tolltag, don't use the tolltag entrances - use the "public only" ones, or you'll have to mess with paperwork to get the charges refunded to your tolltag account. All in all, a great local stay in a convenient area to restaurants, shopping, movie theaters, etc. (we know the area though, so this wasn't an issue) and would definitely recommend the hotel for a variety of reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - but don't try to go anywhere but DFW”
Reviews.Author: edleo13
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel 3 times over the past year (most recently 6/2-6/5/2008) as part of my Company's use of the hotel's meeting facilities. Despite the ugly exterior, this is a very modern, recently refurbished airport hotel with very comfortable rooms. Rooms: All rooms have been refurbished in the last 18 months. Each is equipped with Hyatt Grand beds. I'd say the description on the website is right on -- "ultra-plush pillows, the softest sheeting, and thick down blanketsâ€“all piled atop irresistible pillow-top mattresses." The desk chair is comfortable, the large plasma screen TV gets a bunch of HD channels, and the central air conditioning gets very cold. I'd also give the shower a high grade as the shower head puts out a generous amount of water, the massage soap is fun, and the shower curtain bar is rounded (allowing extra space in the shower). Soundproofing gets an 8 out of 10. Rooms are very quiet however you can detect a faint amount of airplane noise on occassion (not really an issue as the airport doesn't seem to have too many flights between the hours of 10 PM and 6 AM). Location: Somewhat connected to Terminal C (you walk through 2 parking garages). Otherwise, call the Hotel from the phone bank by the baggage carousels in the various terminals and they'll send a shuttle to pick you up within 5-10 minutes. Service going back to the airport is even better as they have quite a few of these vans. Internet: Charge in the room is $10.77, however it's provided free in most of the meeting rooms downstairs and you can probably mooch a free connection if don't mind sitting in one of the public areas. Food: All of the food I've had has been provided as part of my Company's seminars and as a consequence, I wouldn't really say it was representative of what is served at Aces or Mister G's in the lobby. I've had a few drinks at Aces and it's about what you'd expect in a hotel bar. Nothing spectacular however there's generally a pretty lively crowd most nights. Staff: Everywhere. Always friendly and helpful. There always seems to be 3-4 people at the front desk. One thing I really like is how on most days an actual human calls with my wake up call. Seems like such a rarity these days. Complaints: Only one - it is cost prohibitive to go anywhere outside of the DFW complex, without renting a car, while staying at this hotel due to the arcane rate structure used by taxis in Dallas (specifically, the minimum charges and fees for taxis leaving/going to the DFW complex). We took a trip to a Rangers game one night (13 milies away) and it cost the 7 of us (one mini van) over $60 with tip each way. For a 6 mile ride to downtown Grapevine, the cost was over $30 with tip (3 people) one way. I would also be very careful when asking for a taxi through the hotel that they don't try to put you in one of their town cars. The minimum charge most of these rides is roughly $38 (this was a trip to downtown Grapevine, less than 6 miles away). Overall, very nice hotel, just not much of an option if you are going anywhere but airport.

Reviews.Title: “Many positives, but a couple of concerns”
Reviews.Author: Travelingman6
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel two nights during a national junior high chess tournament. We did receive a special "chess" rate of $120 per night, so it was good value for the money. Positives: clean, comfortable rooms with flat screen TVs. It is fairly easy to get in and out of the hotel's parking garage. Be sure to have the hotel validate your parking card, and you'll save the $14 per day. Negatives: As one reviewer noted earlier, there isn't enough hot water in the morning when everyone is taking a shower around the same time. I also didn't enjoy paying $10.77 per day for Internet access. The two or three resaurants in the hotel are very pricey, so I didn't try them.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nolalola
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at other Hyatt's, and haven't been terribly impressed, but this property is exceptional. From the rooms - amazing beds, gorgeous decor, excellent business features, plenty of mirrors - to the STAFF! I have to single out my ABOVE AND BEYOND shuttle drivers Alex and Gary who carted me around for three days during some pretty bad weather, always with a smile and great attitude. These types of employees aren't found everywhere, I hope the Hyatt recognizes that and takes good care of them. I work in hospitality, and if I could I would steal the both of them away. You can't go wrong at this hotel. I was sorry to leave, and I am sure I will be back since my new corporate headquarters is nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Quality Upheld in Rooms, But Not Service”
Reviews.Author: antipodienne
Reviews.Content: OK let's accentuate the positive - these rooms are terrific. Large, well sound-insulated from the airport, beautifully decorated, newly renovated and those Hyatt beds really are as good as the publicity says they are. So why wouldn't I stay here again? Most people wouldn't probably go to an airport hotel for nine days, but I had a conference there for a week and then got snowed in for a couple of extra days. Over this time, the cracks really showed. I'll highlight (or should I say 'lowlight') the three worst: 1. The housekeeping at this hotel was the worst I have ever experienced, and this shocked me for a Hyatt. There were two days when my room simply never got serviced. In addition: - toiletries were not replaced even when completely empty, whether left on the counter or thrown away. Even when I rang to ask that replacements be left the following day, they were not. My colleague who was travelling with me found the same in her room. - the towels, which I'd hung back on the rack to signify I was happy to reuse them, were laundered/replaced each day. So much for environmental commitment. And each day something would be missing - no face cloths or one less towel. My favourite was the complete absence of a bathmat for three random days. Slippery marble floor....fun. - after the first night, they would not leave me a room service breakfast card (the one you hang on your door) despite several requests both to housekeeping and room service. It was laughably ridiculous how many times I had to ring and request one and still there were two mornings that I had to go to the restaurant because I couldn't order in-room dining. 2. The other key issue for this hotel is the food. Fantastic selection if you're there for one or two nights. But beyond that the menu is extremely limited. It looks like they have several venues but when you look at the menu it's just not that different. Tex mex, tex mex and tex mex. There's the odd 'other' option but it's just not sufficient for a Hyatt. 3. At capacity, the hotel runs out of hot water. The snowstorm meant the hotel was full to the gills and I had a completely cold shower to wake up to. Again, not good enough for a Hyatt. While reception staff apologised when I raised these concerns with them, they did nothing and offered nothing. So to be frank I felt it was pro forma and not even slightly genuine. They had my platinum Hyatt membership number and have not followed up in any way since my departure. So to sum it up, and to be completely fair, I don't think you can beat this hotel for a night or two at the airport. The rooms are fantastic, and most people wouldn't be stuck there for as long as I was, so the food will probably suffice. But despite the cardboard smiles, I think the service and the housekeeping leaves way too much to be desired for me to give this hotel anything other than an average rating overall. When I book a Hyatt, I just expect better. Only the rooms themselves live up to the brand.

Reviews.Title: “Easy stay at the Hyatt Regency DFW”
Reviews.Author: kchartsf
Reviews.Content: We booked a two night stay (March 14-16, 2008) thru priceline for a total of $122 including taxes, in town for a wedding shower. I was concerned about being inside the airport with ease of getting to the hotel and the parking situation (we drove in). We were very pleasantly surprised. The signage within the airport directing you to the Hyatt is very good and they plainly differentiate between the Hyatt Regency (by terminal C-where we stayed) and the Grandy Hyatt at terminal D so there was no confusion there. The parking is also well marked and very convenient to the hotel itself. The hotel was quite busy for a weekend with a large high school convention going on, so I had some concern about noise, but we had no problems. When we checked in I requested a room with a view of the runways so we could watch the planes take off and land. They accomodated us with no problem (even though we'd paid so little thru priceline). There was no plane noise and our room was right by the elevator and we didn't hear anything either night. The room was quite nice and as others said the fitness center was great. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great night at dfw”
Reviews.Author: texasdan21
Reviews.Content: my daughter and i had a great time at the hyatt regency dfw.the rooms were larger than a normal room.32 inch flat panel tvs with cable .the beds were very comfortable and soft.the showers were large with very good water pressure.the fitness room had a machine to do every type of work-out(treadmills,weight training,etc.)the hotel has a ground floor with enough conference rooms to handle any event.the pool is outside.the hotel validates parking which saves you $14/day.the hotel is located at the dfw airport in terminal c.the restaurants are pricey .the staff was very helpful and very nice.checkout and checkin took less than 5 minutes total.we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfert for an early flight!”
Reviews.Author: charlie1974
Reviews.Content: Booked through Hotwire for about $100 at the last minute when I needed to take the earlier flight home which was going to mean getting up at some horrible hour. Check in was quick and efficient. The room was beyond my expectations, the perfect size. THE BED...I could live in this bed, the right blend of crisp sheets and a down topper that you just feel yourself sinking into. Room service was delightful with the tortilla soup being superb. Everything was hot and fresh and the waiter concerned that we had every thing we needed. Although it is rumored you can walk to the terminal, the airport shuttle is quick, easy and drops you right in front of the outside baggage check of your airline of church. If only they hit a drive through starbucks on the way!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, OUIET Airport Hotel. . .You will not be sorry!”
Reviews.Author: GuyanaBoy
Reviews.Content: This is a WONDERFUL Hotel! Located right on the DFW property, it is easy to get to by car, or is right on Terminal C, and is an easy walk. The Staff are EXCELLENT! I did not run into a single staff member that was not professional in every way. They called me by name when I made a phone call to ANY department, and treated me GREAT! ! ! The room was Huge! And it was very comfortable as well. I LOVED the flat panel big screen TV complete with Digital channels. There was an iPod dock, coffee pot, hair dryer, iron and board, easy chair, incredibly comfortable bed, and rolling desk and desk chair. The food was great and I ordered several times from Room service. This service was always quick and very good. I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel to anyone doing business in the DFW area. Free parking and free tolls in and out of DFW was a nice bonus. I LOVED THIS HOTEL and actually wish I was there right now. You owe it to yourself to give this excellent hotel a try.

Reviews.Title: “Good Bet for Airport Hotel, especially on Hotwire”
Reviews.Author: cdublu
Reviews.Content: Had to stay one night with my wife and two young daughters so we could catch a flight the next morning. As several reviewers have pointed out the rooms have been renovated and now sport a more modern interior. The rooms were clean, relatively spacious (not large but not cramped) and the new LCDs a nice touch. The beds were some of the best we've slept in while travelling. Sound insulation kept the plane noise outside down and the kids really enjoyed being able to watch the planes take off. Coupled with the super convienent location across from Terminal C and the fact that I was able to get it on hotwire made it a good stay. Only drawback was the hotel restaurant where we ordered the breakfast buffet, which was rather basic given and a tad overpriced at $14 per person (kids are half price or free). But then again when isn't eating at an airport a tad disappointing and overpriced?

Reviews.Title: “totally remodeled”
Reviews.Author: cchambers97
Reviews.Content: If you are needing some place to stay overnight at the airport this is a great property. The hotel staff was friendly, curteous and helpful all at the same time, the rooms were completely renevated and have a new contemporary look with plasma tv's, apple ipod decks etc. Overall my stay at the hotel was excellent oh i forgot about the beds they were comfy as well. This would be a good choice and the rates arent that bad either.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FurryMiker13
Reviews.Content: This is a excellent well priced hotel. We where traveling to a Fairmont Hotel in Bermuda and where spoiled by this great hotel on route. The rooms are supper clean and excellent TV's. Staff was friendly and very helpful. We booked the B&B option on got breakfast included, which i would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Surrounded by Planes”
Reviews.Author: ParticularSFTraveler
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency at the Dallas Airport is a great place to spend the night if you need to be directly in the middle of the DFW area. Thoroughly remodeled, the rooms are nicely designed with contemporary furnishings, colors, and comforts. The bathroom is actually quite upscale, with the standard room missing a tub, but featuring a large glass walled shower. The room has a nice big flat screen television, too. I got a good nightâ€™s sleep in this hotel that is well insulated against noise from American Airlines mega hub. The only problems were a long check-in line, which Iâ€™ve found at other airport hotels because flights are cancelled and the passengers pile in, and low frequency buses serving DFW. As an airport hotel in the middle of the airport (but not connected directly to the airport), the buses should run very frequently. Instead the routing means riders have to ride to multiple terminals to get to their flight, using buses that depart the airport only once every thirty minutes. Next time, I might choose to stay at the Grand Hyatt, which is connected directly to the airport, to avoid the buses, but I still appreciated the comfort design of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice make-over”
Reviews.Author: egatrop
Reviews.Content: The hotel has had a nice make-over. The rooms have been updated. The decor is more like you might find in a boutique hotel. The hotel is a good over-nighter for folks transitting the DFW airport. It is an easy walk from AA's terminal C. Note though, other less expensive hotels are in the area, for just a short shuttle ride.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent weekend value”
Reviews.Author: sam0123
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with my family and we needed a convenient place to stay at or near DFW on Saturday. I chose Hyatt Regency based on great weekend rate, the good reviews here and my previous good experience at the Grand Hyatt at Terminal D. The bus service from terminals on arrival was prompt and helpful; took only a few minutes from Terminal D arrivals. Staff was very courteous and prompt. We got a room on request at the 12th floor with great runway views from the narrow balcony (a sure hit with the 2 and 3 year olds). The room had two queen beds and the newly refurbished decor looked great. The beds were very comfortable and we got a great night's sleep. The bathroom shower had great shower head and good bath products; the floors had mosaic tile strips and walls had a nice textured finish; very high-end feel. The TV was an excellent LG LCD panel with plenty of high-def channels (a pet peeve of mine at many 'fake nice' remodels that have flat panels with bad SD signal). We ordered a full room service dinner, and although expensive, the quality of the appetizers and main course was excellent. One of the best room service meals that my wife or I have had. Our rate included a buffet breakfast, including made-to-order omelettes. Breakfast was also of very good quality. The only two negatives of our stay were a 15-minute delay in getting seated for breakfast (plenty of tables but at 10am on Sunday they only had two waiters on duty), and also oddly enough the buffet didn't include any juices so we had to pay $16 for orange and grapefruit juices. In all, the positives far outweighed here. Great stay, will stay again, would definitely recommend for a convenient overnight when at DFW.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.....”
Reviews.Author: txpatch
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight to catch a flight out the next day and were surprised at how quiet it was for being located in an airport. The staff was very helpful and everyone, including the waiters addressed us by name. If the need arises again, we will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis for marooned travelers”
Reviews.Author: brettandanne
Reviews.Content: We were marooned by our airline for the night, and stayed at the Hyatt Regency. The staff was wonderful! We had to wait in a bit of a check-in line with other airline passengers, and a concierge came around to chat with everyone and to see if we needed anything. He refilled the sippy cups of all of the kids in line (there were a lot of families on my flight), and tried to make everyone smile and laugh in spite of the situation. The front desk and bell staff were so nice, and our room was great. We had to request two pack-n-plays for our sons, and housekeeping brought them to the room and set them up immediately. We gave our kids a bath in the tub, ordered room service, and enjoyed a good night's sleep on high thread count sheets after a long day of travels. We were impressed with every aspect of our night there - these people really know how to pamper weary airline passengers. If you are ever stuck at DFW for the night, the Hyatt Regency is a great choice - practically in the terminal, and willing to roll out the red carpet for just about everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel -- Adjacent to but NOT IN Terminal C”
Reviews.Author: Mid_West_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a layover at DFW. It's a great hotel. The only problem I had was confusion about how to reach the hotel. It is adjacent to, but not in Terminal C. You can either take the hotel shuttle from Terminal C or walk through a series of garages to get to the hotel. I recommend the shuttle as there are several sets of stairs to negotiate if you walk. If you're on the DFW Skylink, you'll need to exit the train at Terminal C - - either stop and then EXIT through security and go to where the hotel shuttles pick you up. The hotel is newly renovated and is very attractive. My room was large, quiet - - soundproofed, and comfortable. The Hyatt Bed is fabulous. I think it's better than the Westin Heavenly Bed or the Marriott Revive Bed. Service was stellar - - everyone was polite, kind and professional. The breakfast buffet in the morning was definitely a step above the usual. Other than having problems finding this hotel at first, I can't think of any negatives. This is a first rate hotel and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: propete
Reviews.Content: Priceline picked the hotel for me and I stayed for one mid-week night during business in the DFW area. My favorite Dallas hotel used to be the Renaissance on Stemmons Fwy, but the Hyatt Regency gives it competition! I used the Hyatt automated check-in kiosk in the lobby, which worked well - albeit slow. It gave me a 4th floor room and when I asked a front desk clerk for a higher floor, she gave me top 13th floor right away. Nice views of the runways towards the west. Room decor is extremely nice; modern, swanky and everything in perfect condition. One of the 2 queen beds had a stain on the sheet, unfortunately - everything else was spotless. Very nice desk and chair. Didn't try the wifi. Had no problem with water pressure, despite the high floor. Had dinner in the lobby restaurant. Great food, good service, a bit pricey - but nothing outrageous when you consider the location. Ordered room service the next morning. It was a few mins early, but accurate and delicious. Central AC was fairly quiet and worked well. Flat screen HDTV with 30+ channels, several in HD. Only bummer was that I couldn't get late checkout since a big group was coming to the hotel. At least the staff was very apologetic about it so it worked out ok. I would definitely return! Sorry for the bad-quality pics from my phone.

Reviews.Title: “Newly Remodeled Good Airport Hotel, Convenient Location Overall”
Reviews.Author: Sammyfloyd
Reviews.Content: Summary: Good airport hotel with great newly renovated rooms and good value on weekends. Expensive food outlets, non-existent gym. Pros: Now just about completely renovated, it looks very different than before. The rooms are large and nicely decorated with pleasing modern colors. The bathroom is remodeled nicely as well. Flat screen TV features HD on some channels. Convenient location with free shuttle from DFW terminals with 5 minutes, or you can just walk across to Terminal C in a couple of minutes. Free parking, and the hotel validates the toll ticket required to access the airport. If you have a car, it is very convenient to access many shopping and dining areas within 15 minutes. Good service overall with the exception of just one annoying bellboy. Appealing outdoor pool. Cons: The gym is temporary at this point so it has two old treadmills, an old elliptical machine and two bikes. No weights except for a couple of medicine balls. They said it will eventually be better but perhaps still not much for weights. Wireless internet keeps disconnecting and costs $11 for 24 hours. Water pressure in the shower is low. Restaurants are extremely expensive. Coffee comes in a 3-cup pot minimum and costs $6, onion soup is $8, sushi rolls $8.50. Appetizers run $12 and up. Entrees $20 and up. Value: I stayed using a weekend AAA rate and it was $101 + tax. The normal weekend rate was $119 + tax. Given the condition of the rooms, it is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely superb”
Reviews.Author: Ray Goldberg
Reviews.Content: This hotel has trained their staff well. This is what service should be. The rooms (beautifully refurbished) are spacious enough. bathroom average but extremely clean. The standouts are the staff attitude and the food. we all know Airport hotels are for the most part, pretty bad. Not this hotel- believe me. Mr G's Restaurant in the hotel is an exception to every hotel rule. The food is absolutely superb, the service impeccable, the wine list absolutely first class. Only downside is, it is expensive BUT, do yourself a favour - eat there. Where will I stay when I fly into DFW??? Right here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Shelter from the Storm”
Reviews.Author: LincolnNavigator
Reviews.Content: We had an unexpected stay at the Hyatt Regency DFW on Friday, March 16 due to the storm that paralyzed all the airports on the east coast. In fact, we we in flight to Boston and had almost reached Pennsylvania when the captain announced that we had to turn around and head back to DFW. What a drag! We were worried that once we reached DFW at 6 PM, there would be no hotel rooms left because of all the stranded passengers. But the minute the plane landed, we were on the phone to the Hyatt. There were no rooms at the Grand Hyatt, but we did manage to book one of the last rooms available at the Hyatt Regency. We were fortunate to get one of the recently renovated rooms (so recently renovated that the 'new rug smell' was quite obvious) on the 11th floor. We had a double bed room to accomodate my husband, 14 year-old son and myself. The room was great---the beds very comfortable and the sheets divine. There was no bedspread on the beds, just a white duvet with a kind of useless runner on the bottom--nice design but totally funtionless. The room had a big screen TV, free WiFi, and a small balcony overlooking the airport. It was fun to watch the planes take off and land (although we wished we were on one of them!) and the noise was minimal. You could hear the planes slightly through the thickly paned windows but it was not a problem. The bathroom was adequate, dark but with nice amenities. I know it's not a PC-thing to say, but I really hate the quality of light that the new energy-efficient light bulbs give off; it's more like a flourescent light quality---cold, blue and unwelcoming. The Hyatt uses these bulbs liberally throughout the room. The TV was great, except the movie we were watching quit just before the ending, due to a failure in the central system. Bummer, but they did not charge us for the rental (expensive at $13.99 per movie). The lobby of the hotel was beautiful, and the staff was accomodating and efficient. I really appreciated the cafe/concessions stand near the restaurants. You could get a quick something to eat or coffee with minimal hassle. We ate in the bar (which had a lot of energy due to all the hapless passengers caught in the storm) after seeing the restaurant's prices. Very high, but an innovative menu. We ordered Nachos (recommended), a Rueben (fine), and the onion soup (highly recommended). The margueritas were great; the wine was a skimpy pour. The ease of getting to the airport, the excellent staff and accomodations, make this an excellent choice of hotels if you are stuck at the DFW airport. Call early as it tends to fill up. I asked one of the desk managers what the difference was between this Hyatt Regency and the other Hyatt at the airport and she said, "Only the spa and the prices are higher at the other Hyatt." Since this Hyatt is newly renovated, and if you don't need a spa, this Hyatt might be a more economical choice. We paid $159/ night which I think was high, because they were capitialzing on the situation, so I imagine at other times, the cost would be lower. Recommedation: Eat at the bar, get a window facing the airport to watch the planes landing and taking off, check quoted pricing; have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great One-Nighter!”
Reviews.Author: BoysInNY
Reviews.Content: This hotel surprised me! The exterior looks old and dated, but once inside it's a very modern-style hotel! The check-in staff was great, and the beds were EXTREMELY COMFORTABLE! I only spent a few hours in my room, but I did get a good night's rest. The bar downstairs is really fun. It's a good way to meet people that are travelling as well. The food is okay, though. If you have friends that drive in to meet you, remember to have their parking ticket validated by the concierge to avoid paying the parking fee. If you have a quick overnight layover at DFW, this is a great place to stay. There are airport monitors by the elevators that can track your flight, and it's only a short walk to Concourse C where you can check in for any American Airlines flight, or take the free green shuttle bus called Terminal Link to get to any of the other four terminals.

Reviews.Title: “No issues”
Reviews.Author: Gurnip
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on an overnight passing through Dallas, arrived late - 9pm. Short queue at check-in, but encountered a trainee so took a little longer than normal - which was surprising, as the booking was made via the Hyatt Gold Passport frequent stayers program. After check-in we grabbed a couple of drinks at the bar and ordered some food. Unfortuanately the both meals were cold on arrival - faulty microwave? : ) Sent them back, same meals returned 10 minutes later 'nuked' - not stylish - advised that we were still not happy, and the manager took the meals and the two drinks off the bill, and offerered a free take away pizza. The hotel seemed to have reasonable faciilties, but as we were leaving early the following morning did not have time to try out the gym and pool etc. Would probably give here another chance if passing through.

HotelInfo.Name: Hyatt Regency DFW
HotelInfo.Address: International Pkwy, Box 619014, Dallas, TX 75261
